dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world turns below us, vast and slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RUMBLE. A shadow sweeps over the land. We move with the shadow. We cast the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landscapes slide by. Reduced by altitude to abstractions: river deltas, forests and flood plains. A raw natural wor No trace of civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadow glides over mountains and glaciers. Across an ocean and a pale beach. Over lowland plain at the foot of VOLCANIC MOUNTAIN it stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE FIGURES walk out of the shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are men - and yet not men. Their skin is snow-white. Their features heavy and classical - as if Rodin's Thinke had risen from his seat. Their smooth heads are earless a hairless. Their glittering eyes entirely black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against the stark land their height is impossible to judg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are ENGINEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of them are cloaked in dark robes of strange design.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third is naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the cloaked Engineers opens a featureless black bo inside lies a cake of dark, sticky material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The naked one lifts the dark cake with ceremonial slownes It hums and buzzes. Foams into iridescent spheres. He rai the seething cake to his mouth like the sacrament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK SCARABS boil out of the dark material. Swarm over h lips. Glittering insects that chitter and bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the swarm his lips melt away. A horrific vision of teeth, black blood, dissolving bone. They are devouring h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fevered glimpse of the microscopic: cells rupture and bleed. Protein chains unfold. A DNA spiral unravels. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scarabs fill their bellies with genetic material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...spreads his arms. Stands cruciform, nearly headless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scarabs swarm his shoulders, his chest. When they rea his hips, he collapses sideways, toppling majestically li felled tree. Engulfed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cloaked Engineers watch impassively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, a vast black SHIP hangs in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if blown by a great gust of wind, the scarabs disperse their millions in all directions. Living DNA on the wing. Where the sacrificial victim fell, nothing remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pristine wilderness. The VOLCANIC MOUNTAIN in the dista

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PRIMITIVE WOMAN stands on a height, staring in amazemen far off a great dark ship hovers over the plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black scarab lands on the back of her neck. Bites deep. Injecting its cargo of DNA into her blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A microscopic invasion. Cells pierced and infused. DNA strands twining and mating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pupils dilating with shock, breath hissing into her lungs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps the back of her neck. Looks at her hand. The sc lies in her palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she watches, it crumbles to dust and blows away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drifting motes of light against the dark: a starscape. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EXCAVATOR floats into view: a sturdy vehicle equipped robotic arms. Bright floodlights beat at the darkness. In the cockpit - a bubble of glass - sits a BEAUTIFUL WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is DR. JOCELYN WATTS, 32, a precocious scholar of ma disciplines. A scientist accustomed to field work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cockpit is sweltering: she wears shorts, boots, a T-s - and still her arms and legs gleam with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts works the controls. The excavator descends toward a rocky surface. Silt billows up as the excavator approache we're not in space at all, but deep underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The excavator's thrusters are cowled propellers. The "sta are plankton shining in the floodlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts steers the excavator to a steeply sloping cliff wal sea-trench yawns below her, its depths lost in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving to survey site B... closing on object four. The large oblong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches the screen of a ground-penetrating radar syst A bright signal return: something hidden in the cliff in front of her. Something big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts carves into the cliff with the excavator's digger a Silt and boulders fall into the yawning trench below. She brings a water cannon to bear: uses its jet to blast away loose silt and stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cliff face collapses: a muddy landslide into the deep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts backs away from the collapse, thrusters whirring to keep her out of the turbulence. A cloud of silt clears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her floodlight beams, the OBELISK stands revealed - it outlines worn by the ages. Easily thirty feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at the obelisk, stunned. Her voice is husky:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Here. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second excavator glides out of the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the controls: PROFESSOR MARTIN HOLLOWAY, 48, visionary genius and archaeologist. Dark-haired and lean, with the rangy build of a frontiersman. He's dressed in work trous and a T-shirt. Stubbly chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plays his floodlights over the obelisk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts floats her excavator down the front of the obelisk. Scanning the alien text. Suddenly she stops. Grips the obelisk with her excavator's arms to anchor herself in pl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to see this.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway pilots his excavator expertly up to Watts's. Mat the two vehicles at their aft hatchways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Watts, a hatch opens with a splatter of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway climbs in. Squeezes into her cockpit. A tight fi He's distracted by her body, pressed so close - but she h eyes only for the inscrutable writing outside the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ephemeris - a star map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radius, inclination, azimuth...more data here... 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we can get epoch and equinox out of that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we raise this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Hundreds of tons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A research vessel at anchor on a turquoise sea. Bright su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, a coastline dotted with villas. The hori is dominated by the VOLCANIC PEAK - the same peak we saw the distance in the prologue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aboard the research vessel, cranes lift Watts and Hollowa excavators out of the sea and onto the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under an awning, PRINTS of the obelisk's faces are stretc on the deck - fifteen feet long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway crawl over the alien text, red markers hand. Parsing, translating, calculating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're tanned, fit, the wind in their hair. The Mediterranean coast in the distance. It's an idyllic way work. But they're utterly absorbed in the task at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still at it. Lights illuminate the workspace. The obelisk prints are blanketed with markings and annotation

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway sits at a table. Watts sits on the marked-up pri Both working through calculations on electronic slates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a solution. A single match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Checked it twice. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts holds up her slate: it displays a set of stellar coordinates. A detailed star map. Holloway holds up his o slate: an exact match. They lock eyes in electric excitem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gleaming space station like a five-spoked wheel rotates grandly against the Pacific Ocean a thousand miles below. Black letters on the white metal read: WEYLAND'S WHEEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A round shuttlecraft approaches the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacecraft no bigger than a private jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts sit strapped into acceleration chairs. only two passengers aboard. New to space travel, Watts te her eyes from the spectacle of Earth outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway plays with a pen, batting it from hand to hand i the zero gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's first? You do climate, I do genetics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archaeology first. Let our ancestors tell the tale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious enough to send his private shuttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weyland can send his shuttle out for pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. If this meeting goes like the others, maybe we should...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't go like the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway plucks the pen from the air. He points out the window, where the crescent Moon shines like a toothy grin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven smiles on our enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle docks with the Wheel's hub - a perfect fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gleaming capsule elevator with windows to the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts float weightlessly inside, moving from handhold to handhold. The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts grabs Holloway by the collar. Pulls them roughly together. They kiss. Not for the first time. They have a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts's hair and clothing float free: she's a naiad in Holloway's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator descends along the spoke to the rim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A luxurious lobby. Tasteful lighting. Eames-era furniture wood and chrome: the past's vision of the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the rim, the Wheel's rotation supplies gravity. An elevator door opens. Watts and Holloway step out - Hollow with a sleek metal folio slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor is the outer surface of the Wheel: in both directions it curves upward out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are all windows: on one side, Earth rotates laz On the other, a wheeling field of stars. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID, an android, stands waiting for them. He's cunningl built, but no one would mistake him for a real human bein

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Holloway. Dr. Watts. My name is DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Weyland's eager to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strides off across the foyer. Watts and Holloway excha a wondering glance and follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID leads past models of planets, moons and asteroids. Holographic labels and data swirl around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are all the planetary bodies on which Weyland Industries has mining claims.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of the hall is dominated by a huge globe of Mars. Markings indicate widespread surface activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Mars. Weyland's crown jewel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that going? The terraforming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say you're getting diminishing returns. It's not working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the greatest engineering project ever attempted. Challenges are inevitable. Mr. Weyland's a determined man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER WEYLAND sits behind a mahogany desk. He's a Warren Buffet type: a country sage, horse-sense and hard knocks. might be seventy years old, or a hundred and seventy. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him stands DIRECTOR LYDIA VICKERS, a slim woman of in a costly business suit. Shrewd and watchful. Once a gr beauty, she now trades in ruthlessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID stands against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway settle into chairs in front of Weyland Holloway holding the metal folio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Holloway. Ms. Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me. Peter Weyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices Watts looking curiously at DAVID. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. DAVID here's a prototype. Our 80 series. One of a kind for now, but if he performs, he will be legion. (his smile fades) What do you want here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway looks at him, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sent you a prospectus that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assume I know nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway swallows. Lays the metal folio on Weyland's desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an archaeologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches a tiny remote. Holographs appear in the air ov Weyland's desk: the folio is a three-dimensional imager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pictures of a younger Holloway in the field: excavating r in Egypt, China, Peru, Greece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my studies I discovered a pattern I couldn't explain. Every eleven hundred years, sudden advances in agriculture, tool use, technology. Inventions. Something caused a great leap forward. Every eleven centuries. The pattern holds as far back as our data goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tens of thousands of years. I had to understand this. It became the focus of my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weyland nods. Holloway glances at Watts and forges on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts was a student of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts touches her own remote. The holographic display tur to scientific diagrams. Images of a very young and beauti Watts in the laboratory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was analyzing historical changes in human DNA. I found the same pattern. Every eleven centuries, a pulse of new information in the genome of the human race. All over the world. Evolution can't do that. Something was changing us. Changing the DNA of our species.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humanity's been visited. Visited by...beings from somewhere else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Weyland, Vickers can't suppress a scowl of disdain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. The others had forgotten Vickers was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia Vickers, Director of Operations. Practically my right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They guided us to civilization. Lifted us up, again and again. I call them the Engineers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you know what you're looking for, it's amazing how the evidence falls into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photographs flicker through the display: Holloway and Wat in the field, excavating new sites. Intimately close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their finds: columns of writing on stone tablets in Egypt China, Cambodia, Peru. Patterns of lines, curves, and dot 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the writing of the Engineers. We've found it on every continent. And last year, we found our Rosetta Stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display shows the Engineer obelisk under the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The writing is a formula giving the location of a single star in our sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're keeping that confidential for now. But that's where we want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to pay for an interstellar research expedition!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a chance to be part of a revolution in scientific...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sell me, professor. You've been turned down by every university and government agency under the sun. Nobody's going to gamble that kind of money on your hunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway deflates. Watts winces. This is a bloodbath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody but me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read your research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible. Our research is-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quantum encoded on secure servers, yeah. We have an A.I. division, you should know. Doing impressive things. (he leans across the desk) I know which star you're wishing on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists stare at Weyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bluffing. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeta Two Reticuli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He regards their shocked faces with satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I got this rich? I ask myself: what does God spend his time doing? And I go and do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts laughs incredulously. Stifles it. Weyland's not jok

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biotechnology was good to me. Fusion power. Lately doing well with gravity systems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swivels his chair toward the window. Earth shines outs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what's the first thing God did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made the Heaven and the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weyland jabs a finger at her like she's won a carnival pr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about. You left out my favorite part. The piece about Earth. DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For eons, Earth's climate swung from hothouse to ice age. Explosions of life, then mass extinctions. But twelve thousand years ago the swings stopped. The Holocene Epoch began - a period of anomalous tranquility. The rise of civilization began only then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts stare at DAVID with new appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that change coincides with a visit by the Engineers. They didn't just change us. They changed our world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the piece I mean. Engineering Earth. God stuff. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swivels back to his desk. Rummages in a drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people checked your science. They say it's solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a thick contract out. Drops it in front of Hollo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you your expedition. Ship and crew, supplies, support. One condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway picks up the contract with the cautious joy of a double-checking a lottery ticket. His voice is husky:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get the discovery. Control of the site. But any technology you find? Anything at all. That's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway reaches out slowly and picks up the contract. Riffles the pages of small-print legalese.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take DAVID with you. My eyes and ears. And Vickers...you're going too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers stares at Weyland in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glittering formation of white crystals. Diamond on diam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The structures grow more complex as the view widens. Leav and branches of crystal. A shimmering field of white jewe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A landscape of white crystals, smooth as snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black void shot with stars, far from any sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sturdy prospecting ship forges through space, travel-wo but built to last. It carries the Weyland Industries logo The name painted on its hull is MAGELLAN. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's nerve center and control room. Six control stations, empty and quiet. Interior lights dimmed to blue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire forward bulkhead of the Bridge is a window: wa to wall, floor to ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the window stands the android DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes at the cosmos with an expression of utter sereni After a long moment he turns away. Massive shutters close over the window as he walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID walks the ship's long central corridor. The ship is silent. The lights dimmed to blue. He is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long steel room containing a dozen plexiglass sarcophag six on each side. Sleep freezers. Inside each freezer: th shadowy shape of a human body rimed with frost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID walks through the compartment, surveying the sleepe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID sits at a display table, moving intricate technical documents across the surface with waves of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes intent on his work. If he is reading, then he`s reading at a speed no human could match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull away from the frosted crystalline horizon, the sm white curves like snowy fields. Form becomes clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the body of a woman. It's Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts lies asleep in her underwear in a plexiglass freeze Pale. Frost on her skin. Venus sculpted in ice. There are lines in her elbows and ankles. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shapes move into view beyond her, outside the freezer. FA Pressed to the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the freezers are open and empty, save two. Hollowa lies in one. In the next, Watts. Three men in blue covera crouch beside Watts's freezer, staring inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are DOWNS, 30, a lean fidgety crewman. STILLWELL, 40 sturdy fellow with the geniality of a labrador. And KAMAR 26, whose dark, brooding air belongs to a man twice his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamarov opens the lid of Watt's freezer. Leans over her. Watts stirs in her sleep, a drowsy angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wakes up slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts wakes to find three men looming above her. Disorien she pulls away. Tangles her hands in her IV lines.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLOWAY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway's voice cracks like a whip. The crewmen jump bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway sits up in the next freezer over. He yanks the I lines out of his arms and legs. Climbs out of the freezer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a moment, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crewmen file out: Stillwell sheepishly, Downs and Kam surly. Holloway goes to Watts. Gently removes the IV line from her ankles while she plucks the ones from her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of sorts. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps her up. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts sit at a table, both a bit hung over. wear civilian clothes. Warmly dressed, they still look co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nurse mugs of coffee and nibble packaged snack bars. Watts hunches over, shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My head's buzzing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just slept two and a half years. It'll pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you've done this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two ship's officers enter the room wearing blue coveralls with rank insignia: GLASSE, 45, a stocky man with thick b hair, and BRICK, 50, a bald man with a bristling mustache

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at Watts and Holloway with little pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain'll see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN JANEK, 45, sits at his desk. With his bristling b and powerful build he has a swashbuckling look, like the captain of a whaling ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts sit on a steel bench in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits scanning his orders: a plastic packet with Weylan Industries logos, cracked open. Watermarked papers inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeta Two Reticuli was surveyed already. A hundred years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By an unmanned probe. Very crude. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Earthlike planets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof of the Engineers' existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirmation of Professor Holloway's theories would change everything. There'd be science before Holloway and science after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek rubs his face wearily with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ticket. I'll put the ship where you want. Run your scans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, your crew's been up for a week. We could've used the time. Why'd you wait to wake us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better for discipline. (off their silence) Men ship out as prospectors for one reason: the percentage. Find a gold mine or a habitable planet, and you're set for life. (he laughs bitterly) But this contract says no percentage. No bounty. Just triple pay. The men aren't happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You unhappy too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm always unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands. Presses his palm against a wall panel. A safe opens. He pulls out a massive pistol in a gunbelt. Tosses orders into the safe. Lays the gun atop them and locks it 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts take possession of their cabin: a simp but spacious room with twin beds and a window to the star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drop duffel bags on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway surveys the arrangement. Frowns. He releases the magnets that lock the beds down. Slides the beds together

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts set up their workspace - a central dis table and huge display surfaces on the walls. Fascinating documents slide under their fingertips: an Engineer alpha Ancient art. Climate and genetic data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID. I wondered when we'd see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust your database is in order. I set it up myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All's well, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID turns to go. Hesitates in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should tell you: the time you spent sleeping, I spent studying your research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts look at the android, his words sinking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You studied our work for two and a half years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite a data set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've seen everything. Well. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID glances over the documents displayed around the roo 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hypothesis is...bold. The audacity of it. Your climate data's undeniable: the Holocene Epoch was engineered. Dr. Watts, your genetic studies are equally conclusive. Pulses of cultural change are harder to prove, but even there your case is strong. I believe in your "Engineers."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A utilitarian sitting room. Steel benches and table bolte the deck. Seated here are two Weyland Industries technici

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDREW CHANCE, 50, a stocky computer engineer with a geni bearing and a bristling salt-and-pepper mustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONA RAVEL, 45, a dour, rangy woman with a plain face, he hair pulled severely back. A physicist and chemist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wear black Weyland Industries jackets. They radiate intelligence and competence. These are pros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID leads Holloway and Watts past the break room. Hollo spots the technicians. Strides in to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weyland Industries! Mr. Chance. Ms. Ravel. You remember Dr. Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and the technicians exchange greetings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the materials I gave you. Some of the technical aspects...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll handle our end of the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway blinks at her. Chance explains, not unkindly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only have a job if you find something. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts follow the imperturbable DAVID down a steel corridor to Vickers's cabin door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open-plan cabin like an urban loft apartment. Watts an Holloway follow DAVID inside. Vickers rises to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls are industrial steel - but the floors are lushl carpeted, the furniture opulent. A king-sized bed, a maho desk, a dining table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gleaming machines ensure Vickers never need step outside: private hypersleep freezer, an autokitchen, a medical pod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a Pauling medical pod? There's only ten of those things on Earth! I guess nine, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Mr. Weyland I wouldn't compromise my standard of living. He accommodated me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I had to cut my manifest. This used to be the number four cargo bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do for you, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway gestures with the slate he's brought with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're about to reach the system periphery. I thought you'd want to see the search protocols we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I was set to be the next CEO of Weyland Industries. Then you came along and sold Mr. Weyland on...this. So here I am. Out of the running. I'll go where I'm told. But don't ask me to play along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when you get back... 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be five years behind the curve. Out of touch. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might make the discovery of the ages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers looks at him as if she's dealing with a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe in what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Weyland believes. That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks them toward the door. Interview's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're out of communication, you can tell the crew what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know? They volunteered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They volunteered blind. Classified job, triple pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew - Brick, Glasse, Stillwell, Downs, and Kamarov - on crates in an improvised lecture hall. Holloway and Wat in front of them. Janek at the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hologram shows ancient images of divine visitations. Th crew is visibly spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shitting me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell is staring at the frightening images: gods and titans towering over mortals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think all our mythologies are race- memories of the Engineers. Horus the Sun God. Prometheus bringing fire from heaven. A pillar of fire, a pillar of smoke. The Engineers are the gods. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamarov stiffens, smelling blasphemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mythology gods maybe. God is God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamarov. Let him talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell's staring unhappily at the ancient images: gods towering over mortals, inhuman and terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're going to meet these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We probably won't meet anyone. You'd expect a star-traveling race to generate radio or laser signals. Fusion drives and gravity drives have clear signatures. But Zeta Two Reticuli is silent. And the Engineers have gone missing on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the pattern, they should've come to Earth seventeen centuries ago. And again six centuries ago. But no sign. After twelve thousand years...they stopped coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn. Janek grins at Holloway across the cargo bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the question you've come light- years to answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only my first question. I have many. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan arrives at the periphery of the system. A distant star like Earth's Sun, surrounded by orbiting planets: mere sparks at this distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the vast Bridge window, the star Zeta2 Reticuli burns, a cold beacon in the night. Downs, Glasse and Bric sit at consoles. Janek paces in front of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts enter - and gape at the view. Janek gr at their reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Zeta Two Reticuli. Edge of the system. Open her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan opens its eyes: two immense telescopes emerg from the ship. Irises open to expose huge lenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antennae deploy: unfurling like wings, gleaming and vast. Sifting vacuum for any whisper of information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the window, the planets orbiting Zeta2 Reticuli a no more than bright stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overlay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heads-up display appears, overlaid on the glass. The su labeled ZETA2 RETICULI. Markers point out the planets and trace the ellipses of their orbits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like magic, the planets swell into colorful orbs, each labeled: Alpha, Beta, Gamma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven planets. Two hot rocks, two gas giants, three snowballs. Nothing Earthlike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts grins at Holloway, eyes shining. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First humans in the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers walks onto the Bridge with DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director. Good of you to join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just getting warmed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor? You know what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMR scan, thirty hertz to three hundred gigahertz. Spectroscopic passes on every planet and major moon. Infrared and albedo scan for hot spots and light sources.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man knows what he wants. Run it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twin telescopes spin and zoom. Antennae flex and focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planet nearest the sun rushes closer as the mighty telescopes zoom in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan's sensors peel planet Alpha like an onion an put it back together again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A river of data floods the display, bathing the watchers' faces with light: Chemical compounds, magnetic field line lunar orbits, topographical data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scan moves on to the next planet, and the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative on radio chatter system-wide. Nobody's talking. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative for laser and maser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the H.U.D., the data stream completes the last planet. Begins to illuminate the gas giants' moons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No biological markers. No artificial light. No industry or agriculture. Dead system. Like always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss-poor, too. Low in heavy elements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a hit! A moon. LV-426.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display centers on Epsilon, a gas giant with many moo Data flickers around one of the larger moons: LV-426.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty-six percent Earth's mass. Atmosphere's nitrogen, methane, sulfates. Faint returns for a bunch of metals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sensors complete their pass on the system's last moon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downs. You heard the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain. Maneuvering. Eighteen hours to orbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan retracts its vast antennae and telescopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines fire: the ship rockets toward the gas giant Epsilon and its mysterious moon. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving the Bridge, Holloway and Watts find themselves walking aft alongside DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID. Enjoy the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that I "enjoy" things. It was informative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was, it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I've seen more convincing humanoid robots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts smiles, watching Holloway's sport. DAVID's speech n varies from its agreeable tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My design's not intended to convince. Simulating humanity is a complex task that diverts resources. My designers dispensed with that burden to optimize for intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why look like a man at all? Why not be a box on wheels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being shaped like you, I can use spaces and equipment designed for you. But I'm not so limited. I hear frequencies you can't hear. I see wavelengths of light invisible to you. I move faster. Exert greater force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists look at DAVID in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see yourself as a superman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his unearthly eyes on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a man at all. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts lie on their bed in their clothes - he head on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they're really there? (off his confusion) The Engineers. They could be there. Waiting for us. What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then all my dreams come true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LV-426 is a gray moon shrouded in clouds. Behind it looms father planet Epsilon, a lurid gas giant banded in red an gold, half swallowed in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan dives into a forced orbit around LV-426: roc firing continually, nose pointed down. Telescopes, sensor and antennae sprout once more from its hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's here. Janek and his crew seated at control stations. Holloway and Watts standing on the foredeck. Vickers and DAVID. Ravel and Chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LV-426 fills the window: a gray orb of mist. The ground invisible beneath the clouds. Sporadic lightning flickers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start with passive systems. We're uninvited guests. Let's be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thought sends a nervous shiver through the others. J nods at Glass and Brick. They study their instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of electromag, all random. That's lightning. Going to bugger up our scans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go active. Mapping radar. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radar emitters extend from their housings like cannons. A THUMP of power as they hammer out a blast of energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display paints data on the moonscape as the wavefront comes back: terrain rendered in luminous green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we just rang the doorbell, if anybody's listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamarov shakes his head fearfully. Crosses himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Icecaps at the poles. Frozen methane. Cold down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The display fills with light: a wave of terrain data swee across the moon's surface as the Magellan orbits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrain data rezzing up. Hey! We got hard spots. Radar-opaque. Bright reflections. That's metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jolt of excitement pounds through everyone on the Bridg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan sweeps on around the gray moon, radar emitte humming, antennae and telescopes open wide. The gas giant Epsilon fills the sky behind LV-426.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it circles, the Magellan launches SATELLITES. Metal mo hurled into polar orbits around the Moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four "hard spots" shine on the moon's surface: an irregular array circling LV-426.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not natural. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see stuff like that sometimes. Mineral deposits. Volcanic ejecta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big one there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new signal appears on the map. Brighter than the others

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No comm signals. No signs of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to get below the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prospecting ship descends through buffeting grey clou Telescopes and antennae stowed away. Hull streaming vapor it cuts atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lightning flashes and booms around the descending ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone strapped into chairs - except Janek, who stands gripping a stanchion, his boots planted on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The landing engines roar. Wind screams over the hull. Mis whips across the Bridge window, obscuring any view. Watts reaches out. Squeezes Holloway's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan breaks through the cloud cover into clear ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below the ship, a vast and eerie landscape is revealed. W valleys mottled with thin dark ground cover. Barren crags spires of rock. Waterless and wind-swept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts gasps. Stares at the grim and foreign country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan thunders over valleys and craggy ridges of r 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek takes the helm. Guides the Magellan down a valley a it were a helicopter. A pilot born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up on site seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crest a mountain higher than Everest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before them stretches a dry barren plain. Scattered rocky peaks rise from the desert floor - an alien Monument Vall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway points to a smaller mountain peak. Oddly regular

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek expertly swings the Magellan sideways. The Magellan circles the mount, nose pointed inward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It revolves below the watchers: flat faces, clean edges - cracked and timework. It glitters like coal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we recording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse nods irritably. Of course they're recording.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers stares at the pyramidal peak, nonplussed. Teeteri on the brink of belief. Watts scans the data readouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tungsten, tantalum, aluminum. That could be technology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second oddly regular peak, even more decrepit than the first, sits on the brink of a vast canyon. Landslides hav eaten at its edges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan purrs over the landscape, dwarfed by the sca Drops between the canyon walls to circle the mount. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts stare at the structure. Beginning to g over the shock. Thinking like scientists again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identical, apart from weathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be a rock formation. Carbon crystallizes like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists pay him no mind. They're past that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see the big one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek pilots by instruments alone. Clouds obscuring the v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing on the major site...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship descends into clear air. A stunning panorama unf before them: craters, hundreds of meters across, connecte trenches. Like a pattern of crop-circles sunk in the rock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the central crater - a huge angular peak larger than the others. The Magellan circles the site. It awe-inspiring. Cryptic. Huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway stares in rapture. Glances at Watts: she nods, e shining. She's with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew's still skeptical - but starting to wonder. They shake their heads and exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No radio. No heat sources. Cold as the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts looks out at the timeworn peak. Its eroded facets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think anybody's been home for a long time. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the central crater, four canals extend outward like points of the compass. Some connect to smaller craters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One canal peters out, flush with the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan lands at the end of this canal - half a kilometer from the central crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare out the window, down the wide straight canal a the pyramidal peak in the distance. Holloway looks around

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let's move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek glances at his instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only six hours of daylight left. Maybe you should hold off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts looks at him incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got that outside the windows and you want to wait `til tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The expedition party emerges from the airlocks - riding C ROVERS, robotic vehicles just smart enough to carry their owners around, or follow along behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rovers' beds are loaded with gear; the explorers ride running-board seats. All wear space suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway drives the first rover with Watts beside him. Stillwell, Kamarov, and Downs in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID drives the second rover with Milburn, Fifield, Chan and Ravel aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air here will kill you, so keep an eye on your supply and watch your seals. Pathogen tests are clean. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move slowly. Stay together. Don't touch anything. Things may be more fragile than they look - or more dangerous. There might be technologies operating here we don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew of the Magellan exchange uneasy looks. Still uncertain what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trench grows deeper as they follow it toward the cent crater - the pyramidal peak framed ahead of them like a monument on a triumphal avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cross a perpendicular canal. Glancing left and right they see smaller craters with central peaks of their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass through the shadow of a high promontory of ston atop one bank of the canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see - and they do not - that the far side of the promontory has a Sphinx-like FACE of monumental size. So eroded that its artificial nature is uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crater floor is a vast enclosed plain. The pyramidal mount looms in the center - colossal in scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rovers enter the crater, trailing plumes of dust. The circle the pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the south face of the pyramid, an IRIS DOOR of many bl stands, easily fifty feet high. Seemingly made of the sam basaltic stone as the pyramid itself. A huge construction

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers are transfixed in awe. All skepticism banis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me that's a natural formation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undeniable proof of alien civilization. You were here on this day, thirty-one December, year of our Lord 2172. History will remember your names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at the iris. Its bottom-most blade is broken lies in rubble at the foot of the door. A dark knife-like aperture leads into the pyramid. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and Vickers watch the explorers' progress in the ma holographic display: their tinny voices echoing over the link. At the sight of the huge iris door in the pyramid, Janek and Vickers stare in blank astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. They were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to stare out the window at the pyramid's peak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers turns and slips out of the Bridge. Hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers strides through her quarters. On the far wall the are two small doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the first: steps into a luxurious bathroom. Was a pill down with a tumbler of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Returns to her cabin and opens the second small door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chamber walled with steel panels. A deep hum of ventila and power: there's a lot of technology here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to a console beside the door. Flips a row of switches. The hum deepens. Hidden mechanisms stir to life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On foot, explorers press inside - Holloway and Watts in t lead. Their flashlights cut into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robotic rovers follow them: their six-wheeled chassis with independent suspension trundling over the rubble barrier, sure-footed as goats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and cavernous. Weak daylight slants in. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers press into the darkness on foot - the cargo rovers' headlights flashing on. They move through a dark cathedral space, empty and bare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID looks around in fascination, his eyes raking the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jocelyn. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice trembles with urgency. He shines light on the r Symbols engraved on the dark surface. Dots, lines and arc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The writing of the Engineers. Conclusive connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID stands beside them. Stares at the alien writing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Professor Holloway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts passes her light over the writing, recording it. Th move on into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID lingers. Reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior is a labyrinth. Corridors big as railway tun intersecting and diverging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers wend their way deeper. Several carry map un whose holographic displays render three-dimensional maps expand as they explore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway leads the explorers deeper into the complex. The motors of the cargo rovers whine and growl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID trails the others, eyes raking the blank walls as i sees something there. He reaches out. Passes his hand thr the air as if grasping a cobweb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STRANGE RUMBLING NOISE sounds down the corridor, freezi them. Holloway sweeps his light that way. The sound comes again: a DEMONIC VOICE speaking some unearthly language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts looks at Holloway - but his eyes are focused on the dark ahead. He moves forward. A beat. The others follow. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An APPARITION appears before them. A PALE, LUMINOUS GIANT fifteen feet tall, with hollow eyes and a grotesque snout strides toward them. Speaks in a sonorous voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts backpedals involuntarily. Seeing Holloway stand his ground, she reaches out to him in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Martin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Holloway doesn't budge. Stares at the Apparition in fascination. Everyone else scatters - except DAVID, who stands stock-still by the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts watches as the Apparition walks right up to Hollowa Disappears with a sizzle of static as Holloway experience the creature passing through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Watts returns to Holloway's side. Stillwell and Downs are huddled on the deck. Milburn and Fifield have fallen back down the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ. Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen by the others, DAVID reaches out and repeats his gesture in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rumbling sound down the corridor, as before. Moments la the Apparition appears round the corner again. They stand their ground: the ghostly giant strides toward them, exac as before, and disappears with a crackle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recording?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more. I'm out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield. Get a grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a prospector. You find a load of bauxite, I'm your man. But not this. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should go with him. Buddy system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hauls a heavy rolling case out of the cargo rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can deploy the drones. Drop them in the first or second nexus on your way back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And half our gear? It's no more than a mile. You can walk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulking, Milburn takes the rolling case. The remaining explorers watch Fifield and Milburn backtrack into the da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts lead their party up to a massive door, sealed tight. In design and scale, undeniably important. Holloway glances at his map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should lead to the core of the pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack it open? Or cut through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's do as little damage as we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravel waves a sensor over the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's power. Current flowing in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chance begins to inspect the frame of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can hack it. Has to be a mechanism... 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID looks as if they fail to see something obvious. He points at a spot on the wall beside the massive slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up a rover. I want to get up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek stands at the window, looking down the long canal a the distant pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's powerful imaging systems stream data: stereosc feeds from the explorers' flashlights; a map that grows a they explore. The maze under the pyramid drawn in light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A globe of LV-426 blooms with terrain and weather data as satellites feed the ship information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers appears at Janek's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director. Taking an interest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my operation, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A junction where multiple passageways converge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn and Fifield trudge into the space, trundling the probe cases behind them. Tunnels lead away in all directi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand Central Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open the case. CAMERA PROBES tumble out: spheres the size of softballs, studded with lenses and sensors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny lights come on as the probes awaken. They roll off, dispersing to investigate every passageway. Bumbling into walls and pillars, reversing. Exploring by random walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's check the feed. Gimme the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had the map unit. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have the map?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trudges back the way they came, in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID stands on top of one of the cargo rovers. He's cut hole in the wall beside the door, high up: he works with probes in the mechanisms inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a three-state switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep BOOM, echoing inside the ancient walls. Nothing mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves a control. BOOM. The immense door begins to rise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast central chamber of the pyramid. An immense space

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway walks in, his flashlight searching. Watts hurrie after. The others follow, rovers tagging along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A colossal structure stands in the center of the chamber, convoluted and strange. A mechanism. Chasms yawn in the f all around it, their depths lost in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers enter, rovers in train. They lift their eye hundreds of feet above them they see the pyramid's apex f within. A SHAFT OF DIFFUSE LIGHT penetrates the pyramid somewhere near the peak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is something, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, it is. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The android's awareness is keyed to a high pitch. He seem read meaning in the inscrutable structures all around the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway hauls a drone case out of the rover. Two dozen spherical drones tumble out, wake up, and roll off into t dark. They are nimble, hopping curbs and skirting chasms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts looks at her atmosphere sensor. Astonished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. This air's breathable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The core chamber brightens as the sun outside moves into alignment. The shaft of light perfectly centered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast SIGH as if the pyramid itself is breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fat drop of water falls on Watts's glove. She looks up surprise. Another falls on her visor. And then it's raini inside the pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water trickles into the chasms, inundating the mossy grow that cling to the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway looks at Watts with a little boy's grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miracles and wonders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaft of light moves on. The core chamber dims slight The rainfall stops as suddenly as it started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers follow the main path around the periphery o the chamber, past a gallery of mysterious machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are marvels in the shadows. Cells in the dark appar open on startling deposits of color: translucent alabaste flutes. Honeycombs of pure gold. Matrices of crystal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts waves a scanning instrument as she walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intense field readings. Huge power sources here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a wide opening in the floor. A strange ram curves downward - its floor segmented and saw-toothed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bafflement: it's not a staircase. Not an escalator. No moving parts. No rails or tracks. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Space below us. A big space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they stand looking, a probe bumbles up to the opening goes bounding down the ramp. Watts laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does this work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to descend on foot. Holloway behind her. Stillwell, Downs, and Kamarov grudgingly follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But DAVID looks away across the cavernous chamber - fixat on the central crystal. He beckons Ravel and Chance to fo him, and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravel and Chance look at each other in astonishment. Uncertainly, they follow DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway, Watts, and the crewmen reach the bottom of the ramp, breathing hard. A cargo rover trundles down after t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look back up. The ramp above them is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravel. Chance. Where've you gone? DAVID! Where are you? (to Watts, indignantly) They didn't come down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Watts is staring through an archway. Transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks in. Holloway follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A passageway punctuated by alcoves as big as band-shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In each alcove stands a biomechanical apparatus - shaped the same dark material as the pyramid itself. Each appara implies by its design that a giant is meant to fit inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts walk the concourse, playing their ligh over the dark machinery. Their footsteps echo. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see, the size of them? Like that ghost we saw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a ghost. Where are the others? I don't want to go back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts fiddles with her suit's comm controls. Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They switched to channel three. I hear them talking. They're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should stay together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn and Fifield are lost. They bumble through the dar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not the same place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is! That is the same freaky thing we saw before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at a detail of the architecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not! The other one was more... sort of...fuck it. (taps his comm) Milburn to Magellan. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts round a corner and stop in their track Kamarov, Stillwell, and Downs almost run into them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists stand frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of them lies a dead giant. An ENGINEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he were standing, he would be fifteen feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is roughly human in shape. Barrel-chested. Withered to bones. There are bulky protrusions fused with his flesh: to say whether they are equipment or parts of his body. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His head, lolling to one side, is severed from his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes seem to be covered by goggles; but if so then th goggles are fused with his skull. An elephantine probosci severed now, once connected to a protrusion on his hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant lies frozen in a convulsion of agony. His jaw gaping in a silent scream. His corpse is marred by hideou wounds: slashes that cut through bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers move closer. Speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts his light. Beyond the dead giant, a vision of He

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen DEAD ENGINEERS lie heaped against a sealed door. Twisted in postures of torment, murdered in the attempt t escape. All bear horrific wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scene of an ancient massacre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and Vickers stare dumbstruck at a 3-D view of the d giants captured by the explorers' cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers circle the decapitated giant, hushed with a Holloway steps close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "There were giants in the earth in those days...and when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, they bare children to them, who became mighty men." Genesis six four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lays a gloved hand reverently on the giant's ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said don't touch anything! You said don't touch anything! 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The size of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In all the old mythologies, the visitors from the sky were giants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts joins Holloway beside the dead Engineer. Touches th corpse in her own turn. It's hard as stone: ossified. She traces the ancient, terrible wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were killed. All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downs stands staring at the dead giant, as shaken as Kama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. The dead can't hurt you. (adjusts his communicator) DAVID. Chance. Ravel. I've got something here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Communications are going to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Magellan's satellites hurtles along, high abov the moon's atmosphere. It passes over the terminator line between the night side and day side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the clouds below, a lightning-laced storm front r across LV-426 like a wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising winds pluck at the ground cover outside the window Janek turns from the view to look at the holographic glob

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands. Back to the ship. We got a mean storm front rolling in. I repeat. All hands... 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing beside the dead giant, Watts and Holloway look a each other as the signal comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: front rolling...back to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've found something here! I'm not walking away for bad weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek shouts into his communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway! I got two-hundred-kilometer winds with airborne silica and enough static to fry your suits. Get your asses back here! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway races their cargo rover away from the pyramid, wheels kicking up dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts rides in back, securing a bulky payload under a tar the cargo deck. Stillwell, Downs, and Kamarov clinging miserably beside her. Watts looks back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive storm front chases them. A tidal wave of dust s through with lightning. Gale-force winds tear at the grou Lightning lashes the pyramid and the crater wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the Magellan, they see the other rover already i the airlock lift. DAVID, Ravel, and Chance aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway roars into the lift at speed, the rover skidding almost into the opposite wall. Watts leaps down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm wall catches up to them. Screaming winds rip through the lift. Dust fills the air. Visibility plunges toward zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me unload! 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls at the tarp. It tears halfway free - and fills wind, snapping taut with such violence that Watts is hurl out into the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts tumbles helplessly: a leaf in the wind. CRASHES int metal stanchion. Clings, the wind knocked out of her. Ear ringing. Nothing but static in her headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway stares in shock at the place where Watts vanishe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jocelyn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With inhuman reflexes DAVID reacts. Grabs a tether. Latch it to his suit. Locks it to an anchor point on the wall. Dives into the storm. A ballet nearly too fast to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID lets the wind take him. Skids across the ground, controlling his trajectory. He hits the stanchion where W is lodged with a CLANG as if he were made of iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at him in mute astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He locks her suit to his. Activates the tether unit's win It whirs, reeling them in through the hurricane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and the other crewmen haul Watts and DAVID back inside. Holloway and Watts embrace fiercely as the lift r toward the safety of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crewmen bundle the rover's tarp-wrapped cargo into a sealed dumbwaiter that rises independently into the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers strip off space suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts pulls her helmet off. Catches DAVID's eye across th airlock. Mouths a silent Thank you. He gives her the bare nod and vanishes into the ship. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers exchange looks. A mood of exuberance and wo prevails now that they're safe home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles of wonder as what they've seen comes home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
