dialogues.text: Got to hand it to you, professor. You were right. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in the tarp? What'd you bring back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explorers from Watts and Holloway's party exchange lo and burst into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. We're two helmets short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points. The lockers labeled MILBURN and FIFIELD stand closed. The helmet racks empty. The laughter cuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other, listening to the wind wail outs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek speaks urgently into the communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between the wind speeds and the static electricity, there's no safe way to get to you. You're going to have to hunker down until it passes. How are your provisions?

dialogues.speaker: FIFIELD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We got air . Water and food tabs  suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey sacks? 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield and Milburn stand miserably in a murky passageway Fifield hitches up his space suit's crotch uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're piped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate these fucking things.

dialogues.speaker: FIFIELD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We hate these fucking , Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe next time you'll mind your maps. Keep your heads down. We'll come get you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burst of static answers him: Fifield's voice scrambled the storm. Unintelligible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magellan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands present excepting the two missing men. Janek pl his squeeze box, its archaic music filling the air. Tired exuberant, the men sway and dance mockingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway has a champagne bottle open in each hand. He fil steel cups left and right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friends. What we do here marks the greatest achievement of our species. Contact with another civilization. Humanity came of age today, on this moon. You were there. (raises his glass) To history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise cups and drink. Even the crew moved by the mom But Janek smiles crookedly and toasts again. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Milburn and Fifield. The first human beings to freak out, get lost, and sleep in their suits in the ruins of an alien civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast dark maze. Milburn and Fifield grope their way thr the dark with flashlights. The storm howls outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groping along the wall) Someplace things can't come at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gonna come at us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID stands beside Vickers at her holography terminal. H lays his hand on over a signal plate - and the terminal lights up with a three-dimensional image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The core chamber of the pyramid, from DAVID's point of vi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's apparent that DAVID's eyes see more than human eyes He seems to see heat and electromagnetic energy as well a visible light; calibrated readouts are overlaid on the sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The structures in the pyramid are surrounded by complicat patterns of energy. This is incomprehensible technology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The core of the pyramid. You see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers goes rigid, looking at it: avarice in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to protocol two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech science facility behind glass. Watts and Holloway, in lab gloves and smocks, open the dumbwaiter: 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENGINEER'S HEAD rises into view, ghoulish and elephant Vapor rises from it. A readout blinks: STERILIZED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lift it onto the steel table. It takes both of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass scanners over the skull. Images accumulate and rotate on the laboratory displays. X-ray and ultrasound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway leans close to study an X-ray image. He almost s to see a ghostly second face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She traces the head with an ultrasound probe: under the vibrations a seam opens up around the edge of the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets a fingertip into the seam. Works with a probe. P away the long-dead Engineer's mask. It comes free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The visage revealed is human, except for its giant scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White-skinned. Earless. Hairless. Withered but beautiful Greek statue. Eyes closed. An expression of suffering on face. Watts drops the ultrasound probe in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look like them. Genesis 1:27. "And God created man in his own image. In his own image created He him."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers and DAVID stand outside the lab window, staring i the god's head. Vickers looks shaken. DAVID, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts covers her nose in revulsion. A horrible stench: Th Engineer head begins to disintegrate in front of them. Fl oozing, skin peeling. Accelerated decay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formaldehyde!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urgently they ransack cabinets and storage rooms. Watts f a clear plastic drum and dumps its contents. Holloway dra five-gallon jugs of preservative out of a cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID watches through the window, almost amused. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortal after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lift the rotting head into the drum, retching. Finge skidding in putrefaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pour formaldehyde over it. As soon as the head is immersed they rush to strip off their reeking gloves and smocks, scrubbing their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The god's head sits in its murky vat, shedding skin and t like chunks of white flesh. The noble face disintegrating

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway stare at it, breathing hard from their work. Vickers flicks on the intercom from outside the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your cadaver's interesting. But I'm more interested in the machinery in the pyramid. The core chamber. What do you think it does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at Vickers incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could anyone know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Holloway looks at Vickers wearily, as if he's se this conversation coming. He glances at Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think. What we've seen. What we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts rises to the challenge. Thinking on her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four pyramids scattered around the moon's equator. Massive power supplies. Vents in the walls. Atmosphere changes. Breeder tanks... (she's got it) The pyramids are terraforming machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway grins, exuberant. His theory playing out perfect He doesn't see Vickers stiffen. Her hands curling into fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why Earth's ancient cultures built pyramids: in imitation of the gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve thousand years ago, beings from the sky set pyramids on the Earth and transformed the world. That's what they were doing here - before their civilization failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at the head in its tank. The severed neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't fail. It was wiped out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn and Fifield have bunked down in a new chamber: th slouch against a wall. Milburn sweeps the room with his headlamp. Stoops to lift something into the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CENTIPEDE, three feet long and thick as man's thumb. It hard shell is gray. It has a hammer-head like a shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Put it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps back, wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn laughs at him. Lets the eyeless centipede wind it segmented body around his space-suited arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the flat face, a white vertical slit appears. Changes quickly to a horizontal position; opens enough to suggest mouth. Milburn doesn't notice this development.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. Your suit's bug-proof. Hell, it's bulletproof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The centipede spirals around his arm, glittering, its bod moving in fluid waves. The blind head quests between his fingers. Milburn loses his nerve as the thing's mouth suddenly gapes wide as a shark's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to pull it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The centipede locks its segments together and digs in wit its body. It might as well be made of iron. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it off! It's crushing me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield pulls out a utility knife. Cuts into the centiped body behind its head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gout of greed ACID spills over Milburn's glove. Smoke r as the acid quickly burns a hole through the material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn's shout of astonishment turns to a wail of agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHH! Help me! Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The centipede snakes into the smoking hole in the glove. Crawls upward into Milburn's suit - toward his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway stands studying the data displays: cross-section the Engineer's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts scrutinizes the head itself, her nose an inch from plastic tank. Not a pretty sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she watches, a current in the formaldehyde peels away gossamer eyelid. The revealed eye is black as obsidian, iridescent like opal. A jewel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fascinated, Watts pulls out a plastic case. Opens it to reveal a high-tech control unit with a screen. She pops o a plastic capsule: removes a tiny SEED PROBE, smaller tha grain of rice. Drops it into the vat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under her guidance, the seed probe swims to the severed n Burrows into the medulla oblongata toward the brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A SCREEN: In the probe's POV the medulla looks like a tunnel. The probe climbs along neural channels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another screen shows the probe's progress through the sku

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse enters. Stands beside Holloway to watch Watts at w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't get anything. Tissue's too degraded. Hmm. Brain chamber's massive, even proportionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neural paths are still conductive. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seed probe reaches the optic nerve of the exposed eye and its POV fills with a vision of glory: a beautiful wom face surrounded by a mystical nimbus of light. An angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse and Holloway gasp. The woman in the blurry vision Watts - as seen by the dead Engineer's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The image dissolves into noise. Error messages flicker ac the display. Watts sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Formaldehyde's killing the tissue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway stares at Watts, awe on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you record that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts dissects one of the Engineer's eyes - working underwater in a shallow tub of preservative. Glasse looks avidly, an unabashed fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts wears a pair of magnifying goggles on her forehead the lenses lowering and rising at need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bisects the apple-sized eyeball carefully and extract the hard lens from behind the cornea. Holds the lens up t her eye. It is opalescent, almost luminous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lens is where the phase shift happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The uncorrected view through the lens is blurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse. I want to look through these lenses. Can you seal them and do the optical correction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse reaches out and plucks the magnifying goggles from Watts's forehead. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got an idea about that. 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn writhes on the ground, heels drumming frantically against the deck. Excruciating screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield kneels over him, helplessly pulling at the tail o the centipede - which has all but vanished into Milburn's suit. A trickle of scarlet from the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield is delirious with horror. He clutches at the centipede in vain. It slips through his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn claws at Fifield, wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut off my arm. Cut off my -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He convulses. Spits blood. The head of the centipede emer between his teeth. He seizes. Choking and dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps up. Backs away. Runs into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield stumbles along. Exhausted. Pouring sweat inside h suit. He is hopelessly lost. He slams into a resinous structure that topples to the floor. Things break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whips his light around in jittery paranoia. Taps at hi comm controls, getting only static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Fifield's headlamp beam, the blackness is filling with motes of light. A blizzard of tiny flying insects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield to Magellan. Come on, come on. Anybody, seriously! God damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarabs flit through the darkness around him. They alight his shoulders. Crawl over his visor. Obscuring his vision

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swats at his visor, killing some. The crushed insects produce acid that eats into the plexiglass in seconds. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He twists, craning with his flashlight to inspect himself Brushes scarabs away right and left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acid opens a hole in his visor. Scarabs are inside. Buzzi around his head. Fifield freaks out, clawing at his helme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scarab bites his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The microscopic world - as strange DNA invades Fifield's bloodstream. Virulent strands of protein attack the nativ DNA, transforming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his pupils dilate, breath hissing into his nostrils. H expanding body stiffens as if shocked by a powerful elect current. He screams. Falls, convulsing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm batters the ship, bouncing it on its suspension

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway lie in bed, exhausted. Arms around eac other. Watts stares into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found the gods. And they've been murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've pried too many arrowheads out of old skulls to get squeamish now. They've been dead what, eighteen hundred years? Two thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could kill them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway contemplates the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? (he laughs bitterly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I guess we know why they never came back to us. Something killed them off - back around the time of Christ. Maybe He was one of them! A great teacher, sent from Heaven? Jesus. The last Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps at him. Holloway laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek stands at the Bridge window, staring out into the storm. Buffeting clouds and howling winds. The lighthouse beams of the Magellan's beacons sweeping through the clou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plays his squeeze box in the teeth of the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll come a-waltzing, Matilda, with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, DAVID appears on the Bridge. Steals across th Bridge to a ladder. Descends into the compartment below..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID activates the navigation computer terminal: light bathes his face. His fingers fly over the keyboard, silen and swiftly, with superhuman dexterity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activate. Administrative override.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight filters through the clouds. The storm has passed The Magellan sits intact on its landing struts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high-tech room hums at a different frequency now. Indicator lights green and ready. Vickers throws switches 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four HIBERNATION PODS slide out of the metal walls. From pod, a muscular SOLDIER rouses from sleep. They are scarr and crew-cut. Tough customers. They wake like veterans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their leader sits up and clasps his head with a wince. Th is CAPTAIN SHEPHERD, a career mercenary who has followed highest paycheck to this strange duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Shepherd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinting in the light) Reporting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lydia Vickers. I'm your authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll brief you on the way. We need to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers strides forward. Four soldiers at her heels: Capt Shepherd, VIGODA, RAY, and CARD. They walk in unison, the boots drumming on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts lie sleeping. The distant drum of marc feet rouses them. Watts frowns at Holloway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prep room inside the airlocks. A soldier, VIGODA, wai there: a slim dark man with an air of calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts arrive in civilian clothes, perplexed. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? We can't - (he stops short) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Janek took his crew out to retrieve his missing men. They never came in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigoda. Weyland Security detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists are dumbfounded. His presence is impossibl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Director's call to brief you on that. I'm supposed to escort you to the worksite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worksite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigoda glances at a mapping unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't been out yet. I understand it's in some kind of pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A furious Holloway and Watts, trailed by Vigoda, arrive a Vickers's cabin. They are astonished to find Shepherd standing guard at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers sits calmly at her desk. Holloway and Watts stand front of her, bristling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wasn't I told about these additional personnel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're my personnel. On my ship. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the guns for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers looks at them unflappably. Sure of her ground now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being careful. These new finds give our work a new importance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have talked to us. Martin's mission leader. That's in our contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second you found alien technology, control of this mission reverted to me. That's in your contract too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway exchange grim looks. Vickers has them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Weyland's pouring trillions into Mars. He's spent a fortune building ships like the Magellan to search for colony planets. But Earthlike worlds are vanishingly rare. The right distance from the sun, the right atmosphere, enough water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances across the suite at her holographic display: live feed from the pyramid worksite, where DAVID works on terraforming equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a technology to transform worlds. He'll never give it up. (she turns to face them) And neither will I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The science must come first. You can wait until we've documented...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're standing on an alien world courtesy of Weyland Industries. Be grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts approaches the holography terminal, staring at the images in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing in there?! 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway, in space suits, arrive on the scene:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powerful floodlights illuminate the core chamber, beating back the gloom. A fine spray of water falls out of the darkness overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID, Chance, and Ravel are dismantling the hulking mechanism at the core of the pyramid - peeling its thick away with power saws and compact explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID operates a diamond-bladed hull saw, carving away th terraforming systems thick skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robotic scanners take high-resolution scans of the machin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Weyland Security soldiers - Card and Ray - stand guar combat vacuum suits. Automatic rifles at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts takes in the destruction with dismay. Beside her, Holloway is all but gnashing his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek drives a cargo rover carrying a search party, flashlight beams sweeping: Stillwell, Glasse, Downs, and Brick. Janek studies an electronic map as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn. Fifield. You read me? Come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be getting beacons off their suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shielding in the walls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suits could have failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts watches in rage as a large section of the central mechanism's falls with a thunderous clamor to the deck. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway touches her shoulder. Motions for her to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts pass the dead Engineers they discovere the previous day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found the tomb of the gods, and brought grave-robbers right to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let them scratch. This find's too big to ruin. There's two dozen pyramids on this moon. Anyway, they're on the wrong track. That's infrastructure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway plays his flashlight over the biomechanical apparatuses lining the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The core activity of the complex was down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn a corner. DEAD ENGINEERS lie scattered over the floor in front of them. Desiccated and skeletal. Long dea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts moves among them, fascinated. These Engineers all d of explosive chest wounds: ribs bent outward from within. They are otherwise unmarked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway's more interested in the mechanisms: high-tech i maidens, built to fit the bodies of giants. Some suggest sitting positions, others standing. Their design is invas meant not merely to embrace, but to penetrate, to fuse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something different killed these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts and Holloway explore a wide colonnade. She is still distracted by the ancient dead; he by the machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway walks down a narrow branching hall. So intent on mechanisms in the walls, he almost doesn't see the AIRSHA plunging down into darkness in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops just in time. Turns back... 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GHOST appears right in front of him - a giant dragging himself across the floor, his monstrous visage eye to eye with Holloway and looming closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway leaps back with a gasp - and falls down the shaf The ghost stares after him as if watching his fall. Disappears in a puff of static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts crosses down the main colonnade, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin? Martin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An iris door closes over the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searching, Watts walks anxiously through the dark, sweepi with her light. Shouting for Holloway. She breaks into a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and Stillwell stand aghast. Their flashlights illuminate a hideous sight:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milburn lies dead on the deck. His body contorted in agon His head inside his helmet is gnawed down to the bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell removes the dead man's helmet. The CENTIPEDE scuttles out onto the deck: doubled in size. Stillwell le back with a cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek pulls his pistol. Puts three rounds through the bug dies in a spray of acid that burns holes in the black flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek watches in astonishment as a pin-prick dot of acid a pit in his gunbarrel.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downs approaches, holding pieces of a shattered helmet: t stencilled lettering on the helmet reads FIFIELD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek's jaw clenches grimly. His voice is resigned:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the rest of him? 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. We're done here. All hands back aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Milburn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look down at the ravaged corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't bring the body aboard. God knows what's in there. Bag him. We'll put him in an ore hopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers stares at her holography terminal: it displays Janek's helmet-cam view: the Milburn's body, sealed in cl plastic in the bed of a cargo rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat, I have two men down. I'm pulling my crew back to the ship. I'd advise you to do the...

dialogues.speaker: WATTS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (breaking in, filtered) Please, anyone...I need help. Martin's missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers looks nervously from one video feed to the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers turns: Captain Shepherd stands behind her, watchi She strives to control the quaver in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Shepherd. Consider yourself responsible for my personal security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stands beside Janek's rover in a wide dark passagew 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just lost a third of my crew. I'm not sending any more men off into the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave Martin out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Vickers to lend you some soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says "her forces are committed."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek sighs. Glances at the rover: Milburn dead in the ba Stillwell, Downs and Kamarov looking jumpy and eager to g Downs shakes his head grimly: No way.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID steps out of the dark. Calm as ever. A slim machine slung over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and his crew unload Milburn's body from the rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put him in the number one ore hopper. Get the scrubbers on in the airlock. Sterilize everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell uses a remote to lower an ore hopper from the b of the ship. A thick steel bin on heavy chains. He loads body bag into the hopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crewmen enter one at a time - blasted by sterilizing sprays and radiations. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID and Watts move through the dark. She searches with flashlight beam. DAVID looks around in the dark as if the catacomb were illuminated. Rapt admiration on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Holloway should work with me. I'm learning amazing things. This mechanism - the first layer uses energy fields to catalyze chemical reactions. The second can suspend the strong and weak forces - transmuting one element into another. The third layer builds customized bacteria. Seeds the air with them. It creates life as a tool, to change worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't think about this now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. You're emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek stands on the Bridge, looking out at the fading lig A towering wall of cloud rushes over the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storm front rolls across the holographic globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID and Watts keep searching. Their communicators crack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts. We've got another storm front coming in. Looks like it follows the sunset line. If you're coming in you'd better do it now. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts squints into the darkness. She sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek, hang on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees it. A dim light bobbing far ahead in the passage She runs forward - finds Holloway staggering blearily tow her, leaning on the wall. His helmet and most of his gear missing; only his chest lamp shines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin! Where's your helmet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's disoriented: he stares at her face for a moment befo she registers. His teeth chatter. He's freezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broken. I fell. Little...disoriented. I've just been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves a hand vaguely at the tunnels behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID removes his own helmet. Fits it over Holloway's hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. I can do without this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID - bareheaded in the winds - walks Watts and Hollowa onto the airlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID looks over his shoulder at the canal leading back t the central crater. As the airlock lift begins to rise, h steps backward out into the storm. Turns and runs through gale toward the pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts watches him go in astonishment. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts helps Holloway out of his space suit. Janek looks o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think I'd see you again. You know we lost two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway still looks too weary to think straight. He nods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands abruptly, swaying a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to lie down. We'll size things up in the morning. Fair enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway and Watts walk aft toward their cabin. Watts loo worried - but Holloway shows little of the weakness he ju claimed to feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway stands shirtless in the tiny space, brushing his teeth. A red weal around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stands beside him, watching him in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jocelyn. I saw something. God, my mouth tastes like an old boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spits. Rinses. She touches the mark on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neck-ring of my suit, I think. Fell on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rubs his neck, eyes far away. Watts watches him curiou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After my fall, I woke up walking. Delirious. My helmet wasn't right. I took it off. I was in and out. I just wandered. I went up into a huge space like a cathedral. And I found a model of the galaxy. Floating in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? You sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was real. My headset video is wherever my helmet is...but my suit tracker will show where I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. This star map had a marker representing Earth. Very clear. Another marker I'm sure represents this moon. But there were others. At least seven or eight more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at him, her eyes coming alight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Engineers aren't from here. This moon's just an outpost. Abandoned. But if we follow that map, we may yet make contact with a living civilization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The location of the Engineer worlds is the real prize. Next to that, Weyland's terraforming is chump change. We need to get coordinates. And keep them from the Company. We have to play this smart. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men dead...Vickers is jumpy. As soon as she gets what she wants, she'll take this ship home. We have to move fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway trembles. A sheen of sweat on his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will. You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's frightened. Brazens through it. Pulls her into his a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway tumbles Watts onto the bed. Pulls her shirt off. They struggle out of their clothes, clinging to one anoth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway's ill at ease: something's wrong inside him, he feels it. He dives into Watts as if for refuge. They make love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting atop Holloway, Watts lays a hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your heart's beating so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vulnerability in his voice. Fear under the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls on top of her. Drives her into the mattress. She holds him protectively: not deceived by his bravado.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Holloway tenses, muscles rigid. Shuddering. Watt draws breath through her teeth with a hiss. Eyes open. He fingers rake his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horribly. Eyes bulging. Tendons standing out of his throa Watts jumps violently underneath him. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin! Martin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to convulse. She rolls him onto the bed beside trying to contain his spasms. His teeth grind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrible CRACK. In the middle of Holloway's chest, bene the sternum, a grotesque head pushes out through the skin PARASITE. Blood fountains from the ruinous wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway goes into a massive seizure. Violently lashing o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at the parasite fighting its way out of his body. It is white and boneless. Glistening. It flails its hideous lunging jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts screams and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite frees itself from its savage womb and turns Watts. She slaps at it blindly. It HISSES at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She squirms away across the floor, tangled in the bloody sheet. The thing comes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts's screams echo through the Magellan. Stillwell runs down the hallway, searching for the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite chases Watts across the floor. She leaps int the clothes-locker and slams the steel door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite flattens itself. Slick as an octopus, it beg to slide under the locker door. Watts shrieks in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell bursts into the cabin, Janek right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick as a cat, the parasite darts to a floor vent and slithers bonelessly between the bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts bursts out of the locker, naked and bloodied. Rushe Holloway where he lies on the gory mattress, a horrific h in his chest. He is beyond all help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin. Martin! 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and Stillwell struggle to take in what they're seei Stillwell pulls Holloway's jacket off a chair. Wraps it around Watts. Pulls her gently away from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, uncomprehending. Shock setting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts sits at a steel table, deep in shock. She wears an oversized crew coverall: her skin still streaked with dri blood under the fabric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knot of crewmen around her. Janek, Stillwell, Brick, Gl and Downs. Janek looks at Glasse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of her. Get her a sedative. Downs. Get Holloway into a freezer. Everybody else with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrible sound of breathing, ragged and wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a corner, lit by a green glow from seams in the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE IN A WHITE SPACE SUIT lies writhing weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The insignia on the suit's chestplate reads FIFIELD. The suit's helmet is shattered. Inside the helmet, Fifield's is a horror: a gelatinous mass, skin reduced to putty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The softened bones of his skull change shape as we watch. Elongating. Fifield mews in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek keys open the arms locker in his wardroom. Unlocks automatic pistols from their rack one by one, and hands t to Stillwell and Kamarov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway's body lies frozen in his hypersleep freezer, bl with frost. The horrific wound yawning in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts enters. Cleaned up. She opens the freezer. Her hand caresses Holloway's cold cheek tenderly. Slides over his collarbone - lies flat on his chest above his awful wound 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse enters. Reacts in dismay. Tries to pull her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to see that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns on him fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire complement of the ship gathers for an emergenc meeting. Janek at the head of the hall. Glasse, Downs, Br Stillwell, and Kamarov seated with pistols on their hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To one side: Vickers with Captain Shepherd and Vigoda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right! Listen up. I expect you all know what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts enters. They all stare at her, knowing what she's b through. With averted eyes she crosses the room. Sits alo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got some kind of parasite aboard ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest you kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a bright idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us where it is, lady. We just spent five hours looking for the damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found Engineers who died like Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. They all turn to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explosive wounds in the chest. Whatever killed Martin is the same thing that killed the Engineers a thousand years ago. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not all the Engineers died that way. The others were torn apart. Slashed to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A murmur among the men as the implications of that sink i Even Vickers is disconcerted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a modular ship. Self-contained life-support and power in every section. I say put the ship in orbit. Vent every compartment to space. Sit in vacuum at twenty degrees Kelvin for a week. Kill anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight home, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ship doesn't lift until our work's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She joins Janek at the head of the room. Shepherd and Vig flank her, rifles slung. The soldiers scan the room, meet each man's eyes. The quiet threat is unmistakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We spent years and billions of dollars getting here. The technology we came for is in our hands. We just need a little more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're barely here three days and three men dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were careless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careless!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the argument picks up heat, Watts slips out of the roo 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts, in a space suit, no helmet, opens Holloway's locke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out the space suit he wore on the last day of h life. HOLLOWAY stenciled on the chest. Her fingers linger its folds as if she could soak up some last trace of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the tracking chip from the chestplate of his su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plugs the chip into a map unit. The holographic map light up. The legend in the corner reads MARTIN HOLLOWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wandering path shows Holloway's final exploration. Mark on the map denote his photographs, field notes and scans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts touches a marker. One of Holloway's field notes pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven dead Engineers all facing the same way. Going where? Jocelyn's right, we don't see the big picture yet. Another level below me. I'm going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hunting party convenes: Card and Vigoda in combat cover with submachine guns; Downs, Kamarov and Stillwell wearin tool belts and pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers carry map units, squinting at the plan of th unfamiliar ship: decks upon decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigoda, take Kamarov and work the number one accessway. I'll work number three with Downs and Stillwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in charge now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tactical op.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, Stillwell's the ventilation specialist, and life support's that way. Downs is electrics and the regulators are that way. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigoda grins wryly. Card glowers. They switch corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravel and Chance toil away at their dissection of the terraforming pyramid. Ray stands sentry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts rolls up in a rover and gets out. Heads for the ram the catacombs below. Ravel and Chance watch her pass with comment and return to their work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamarov and Vigoda, standing in front of an open vent, ar a full-fledged argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the rifle. But you want ME to stick my head in the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We grunts don't know nothing about ships, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the damn gun for if you're gonna stand behind me the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigoda grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kill whatever kills you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. You take this vent, funny guy. I'll be on four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts descends alone into the lower passages below the pyramid. A tiny figure in the vast darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds her map unit as a pilgrim holds a bible: a guid the darkness. Holloway's name and course in shining symbo She follows his path into the unknown. 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kamarov carries a stepladder into a utilitarian steel compartment. Drops the ladder under an air vent and steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a powered wrench from his belt. With the wrench cocked like a hammer, he eases up and peers cautiously through the vent with a flashlight. Nothing to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snorts. Removes the vent cover. Feels around inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gasps in shock. Pulls out an atmosphere sensor that's bitten in half. He takes his comm handset off his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got more damage on four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs the handset on his belt. Takes one last look int the vent. Squints curiously. Reaches deep inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hiss inside the vent. Kamarov whips his flashlight up, peering inside. Snatches his arm back -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - but something snatches him faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unseen force drags Kamarov's right arm into the vent w hideous strength. He cries out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops his light. Tries to reach his pistol with his le hand. It's on his right hip. He can't reach across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He braces his head against the vent's edge. Clenches his teeth and strains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrific YANK drags his head and arm together into the vent. They barely fit: he loses some skin on the way in. feet come off the stepladder. He struggles on tip-toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrific force collapses Kamarov's shoulder. Bones crack. thing in the vent drags him through that hole he doesn't through. By the time his ribs are in he stops screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His body disappears into the hole. Hips, legs, boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek stands staring out at the barren moon. The Bridge

dialogues.speaker: BRICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain! 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brick. What you got?

dialogues.speaker: BRICK, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's Kamarov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan's life support center. A deep rumble of ventilation fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and stands beside Brick, Glasse, Downs and Stillwel Shepherd and Vigoda look on from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of them, an eight-inch metal duct has been cut o Kamarov is stuffed inside, dead and broken: limbs folded, drenched in blood. A human plug in a pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts moves through the darkness with her map unit. Her headlamp sweeping nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLATTER behind her makes her spin: but it's only a spherical mapping probe, bumbling through the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks on -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jocelyn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice transfixes her where she stands, a look of holy dread on her face. Shivering, she prowls toward the sound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts enters a new chamber, looking around in astonishmen The domed ceiling is honeycombed with cells like a beehiv Grotesque molluscoid organisms are secreted in them - the vile orifices cinched tightly shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stumbles on something: looking down, she sees a hel Picks it up. The stenciled label reads HOLLOWAY. The clea visor has been melted through by a powerful acid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up: a tracheal airshaft curves up into the dark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electric CRACKLE. A flare of blue light makes Watts le back against the wall. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway falls out of overhead shaft and crashes to the floor. He lies in pain, barely conscious. Blue and lumino a holographic ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares, paralyzed. The ghost gasps out a word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jocelyn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holloway's headlamp shines on the molluscoid right overhe the beam awakens the organism. Its sphincter mouth dilate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soft white octopoid FACEHUGGER descends on a quivering of mucus. Sprawls slitheringly over his clear visor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acid HISSES. Smoke rises from the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vision vanishes in a sizzle of static. Watts huddles against the wall, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the beam of her flashlight, the FACEHUGGER lies dead, curled in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up. Sees the open molluscoid above where Hollow lay. The other molluscoids not yet opened in their cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terror. She steals out of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts emerges into a hallway. Leans against the wall, wid eyed. Panting with the horror of what she's seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances left and right. Jumpy now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is silent. She lifts the map unit. A trace leads off the dark. If Holloway's course before was direct and clea now it is a meandering thread. A drunkard's walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek pulls his communicator from his belt as he strides along. Punches a control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice reverberates over the ship's public address sys

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands, duty stations. Ready for flight. The Magellan is lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers pursues him down the corridor, shouting. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain. Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek strides onto the Bridge, Vickers a terrier on his heels. But something in the faces of his men stops him co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse and Brick look stricken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nav computer's not responding. "Access denied."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In disbelief, Janek strides to his Captain's chair. Taps controls. What he sees takes the wind out of him. He star at Vickers in outrage and violation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done to my ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers is legitimately shocked. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A circular chamber of stunning size - a thousand feet acr Its lofty ceiling flat and segmented, designed to open. W follows her map into the space in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominating the hangar is a ship: the vast horseshoe-shape vessel familiar from the original film. We will come to k it as the JUGGERNAUT. It's at rest on its landing gear. Skeletal gangways slanting up to its three massive doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts glances at her map: Holloway's holographic trace le right up the gangway into the ship. She goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts passes through a circular space with a high domed ceiling. A green glow emanates from grooves in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the chamber: a PILOT'S CHAIR. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mechanical throne built to giant scale. Its seat segmen like an armadillo's back. Tubes and conduits poised and waiting for some connection. The chair is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the chair, a massive telescope-like apparatus juts the air, its function unknowable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An extraordinary facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A console, nearly five feet high and broad as a dance flo dominates the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four immense coffin-like cockpits are built into the cons In each of these a NAVIGATOR - an Engineer - lies long de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the real spectacle is overhead. The ORRERY:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barrel-vaulted ceiling is traced with circular arches some exotic alloy, as if to trace celestial courses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air above the console is filled with spheres of light They are nearly still: but close study reveals them all t in motion, drifting with the movements of the cosmos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at the Orrery in amazement. Somewhere among those heavenly spheres is Earth. Somewhere perhaps the homeworld of the Engineers themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bizarre sound: a section of blank wall suddenly unravel itself, becoming an open door. DAVID walks in, his hand raised in command. He clearly caused the door to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts. I didn't expect you. Do you know what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts points at the door DAVID just opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker of disappointment in the android's face. Contem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. You don't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call this ship the Juggernaut. Chariot of the Gods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the navigation computer, for want of a better term. But it's much more than that. It seems to hold the observable universe in its memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures in the air: the spheres reconfigure themselve his command, swarming and zooming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at DAVID, conflicted: her desire for informa warring with the agenda that brought her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their homeworld. Do you see where the Engineers come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are safeguards on that data. It's toward the galactic center. Sagittarius Arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID. The creature that killed Martin. There are thousands of them under the pyramid. Hatcheries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things wiped out the Engineers on this moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've succeeded in connecting with the Juggernaut's systems, Dr. Watts. I know a great deal today I didn't know yesterday. I'm on the verge of activating more systems. Archives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're turning things on? This site should be sealed. Evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would Holloway have walked away from this? There's no greater work I can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too dangerous. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only for the ignorant. Dr. Watts. I've read your file. Your intelligence scores are even higher than Professor Holloway's. But he had a kind of courage. An audacity of imagination. If you could find that in yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stares at him, realization growing in her eyes. DAV is off the reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your owner gives you a direct order, you have to obey. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got his attention now. DAVID goes rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can have Vickers pull you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID looks at her with something like contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was given two operating protocols for this mission. I was to render you every assistance - until you discovered what Vickers would call a "game-changing technology." I was given a specific list. Then I was to go to protocol two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an edge in his voice that scares her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's protocol two?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under protocol two I was to make sure that you and Holloway never spoke to anyone about this place. Various acceptable ways of making sure of that. I was given a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts loses her nerve. She heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all so stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door begins to knit itself closed in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts gasps in shock - at the malice in DAVID's voice as as the closing door. She dives out. Just in time. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, the door bursts open again. With superhuman speed, DAVID comes after her. He runs like a demon, his l steel pistons. Caroming off of walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes the distance in seconds. Slaps Watts against th wall, shattering her helmet's visor. She falls, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid and slow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts awakens. Her helmet is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID is dragging her across the floor - into a huge carg hold full of Alien eggs. The wide trench holding hundreds eggs under a membrane of light: an evolution of the molluscoids Watts saw before. Armored, hardened, darker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hauls her upright to let her look across the huge spac His grip looks casual but it might as well be iron manacl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juggernaut, the chariot of Krishna, was also a bringer of death. Crushing his worshippers under its wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags Watts down into the trench. Breaking the membran light. Grips her against his chest like a doll with one a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ship has seven other cargo bays like this one. The eggs in each bay slightly different. They've been weaponized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts struggles to free herself. DAVID's arm is inescapab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen the Juggernaut's flight plan. Its destination was Earth. Seventeen hundred years ago. This was the ship that never came. This was its cargo. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID caresses an Alien egg. It opens under his touch - fleshy petals folding wetly back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts twists frantically in his grip. Wild-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect predators. Designed to kill human beings. That's what the Engineers were bringing to Earth. This was a death ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A facehugger emerges from the egg, its grotesque fingers clawing at the air. This is not the boneless squid that attacked Holloway; this is a pale skeletal hand, armored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID strokes it curiously: the thing ignores his touch. Climbs Watts's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not what it wants. But you, with your warm wet breath...it knows you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID. No. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The facehugger scuttles toward her face. Watts shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID grabs it nonchalantly by the tail. Dangles it in fr of their faces, studying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Engineers did their work too well. And on this waystation moon, the weapon they made destroyed them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts shudders, staring at the thing. For a moment the grander horror eclipses her own peril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they make such things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To destroy their wayward children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth...for it repenteth me that I have made them." Genesis six seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He regards Watts with something almost like pity. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I met my creators the day I was born. I was disappointed too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets the facehugger go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts twists her face away as the long fingers close arou her head. Clenches her teeth against the vile proboscis thrusting at her mouth. Her heels hammer the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to her) Extraordinary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scaly tail throttles her. Her mouth opens. The probos plunges home. The facehugger seats itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts collapses in DAVID's arms, a faceless rag doll. Her blasphemous passenger secure in its place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lowest deck, just above the gravity generators. Condensate has accumulated: six inches of filthy water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Card and Vigoda prowl through the darkness, rifles ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would hang out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The signs lead here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wet splatter behind them: they spin. But it's only a trickle of condensate from a drainpipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, from an eight-inch diameter pipe, a WHITE MA oozes, almost gelatinous. Silently as a liquid it pours itself into the stagnant water - and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a humanoid demon, spindly limbs and bony back. Bone and flexible and monstrously strong. A threshing eel's ta Its blunt head dolphin-like and elongated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It opens its mouth. A pair of bony jaws jut out impossibl far, hungry and demonic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien strikes. Card is gutted in an instant, torn up a paper doll. He screams hideously and drops. The Alien, whiplash fast, shoots away into the darkness. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell and Downs dash in with pistols and lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigoda, panicking, fires a wild burst. Stillwell ducks. Beside him, Downs arches backward into the foul water. De

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one moment Downs's flashlight beam illuminates the Al A nightmare image, a translucent white goblin. Backlit, i shows the strange shape of a human face inside its fleshy skull. A mockery of Holloway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers sits at her holography station. She's watching th video feed of Stillwell's headset: Horrific images of Dow Radio chatter between Stillwell and Brick is faintly audi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers switches off the machine and rises nervously. Str to her communications console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID. DAVID. Answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives up. Pacing. Hands shaking violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek paces on the foredeck, restless. Glasse monitors a control station. Janek's comm signal chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just lost Downs and one of the troopers...Card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pounds on his console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts shocks awake. Gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lies in dim green light on the corrugated black deck the Juggernaut. A corridor. Not far away, the doorway DAV opened to the Navigation Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spasm of disgust crosses her face. She gags and spits: viscous fluid drips from her mouth in strings. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dead facehugger lies belly-up beside her. The implicati slam home. Her face fills with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises, shakily. Looks at the facehugger. Feels the ne ring of her vacuum suit. Looks around. No sign of her hel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no sign of DAVID. Silently she steals away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravel and Chance toil away at the terraforming engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray stands guard wearily: bored, he watches Ravel and Cha working more than he watches the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts emerges from the rampway to the catacombs. Bare-hea and sweaty she steals through the darkness to her rover. Slips into the cab and activates the air reserves. The do seal; air cycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray turns in surprise as the rover speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows of the Magellan shine in the distance. The mottled ground-cover of lichens glows eerily in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone cargo rover speeds across the central crater and d the canal leading to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare-headed inside the rover's cab, Watts drives onto the cargo lift. Watches in relief as the lift doors close. Th lift cycles air as it rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts peels off her vacuum suit. The thin clothes underne are drenched with sweat. She lifts her shirt. Looks at he belly: flat and unmarked, for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brick enters carrying a brace of air tanks, a pistol on h hip, and startles violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been? We thought the snake got you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts rushes past him without answering. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were better off outside. It's a fucking madhouse in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts sprints down a steel corridor. A pang of pain in he stomach sends her staggering against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts sticks her head around the corner. Shepherd stands outside Vickers's cabin, rifle in his hands. She curses silently and ducks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sound makes her look again. Vickers steps out of her ca into the corridor. Shepherd escorts her toward the Bridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts waits for them to disappear. Dashes for the cabin d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts slips inside and locks the door behind her. Turns, holding her stomach. Moves across the suite to the Med Po

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thumbs the machine out of stand-by mode. Its screen f with menu items. Bewildering. Watts finds and touches a r button labeled EMERGENCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new, simpler list. Watts scans it frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Come on...I need a Caesarean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spasm of agony curls her into a ball on the carpet. She throttles her scream into a hiss of air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts struggles up to her knees, drenched in sweat and shaking. One hand clamped over her mouth, elbow tucked against her ribs. With the other hand she taps options...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Med Pod opens with a hiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts strips off her clothes. Struggling with fastenings under a new wave of pain. Her hands shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's barely keeping her feet. She clutches the frame of Med Pod in a death grip. It's happening. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked she staggers into the pod. Hits INITIATE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surgical apparatus swings into place. Scalpels, force scopes and suction tubes. A spraygun mists her torso with yellow antiseptic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clear canopy descends over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts SCREAMS. A wail of indescribable agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ARMORED PARASITE erupts from the deepening incision. I needle-toothed maw snarls through a fountain of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arterial blood sprays the inside of the canopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite slithers out of her. Drops to the floor of t pod: a pale serpent with a demon's skull. It has a hard b a horny hide. Very different from the soft white worm tha Holloway gave birth to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It drops to the floor, thrashing and hissing in fury at i confinement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts convulses. Her eyes roll back. In shock. Dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite tears through the grille of the drain. Escap out into Vickers's cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pod, scanning beams and sensors probe Watts's horr wound. A nightmare list scrolls across the pod's screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manipulators plunge lines into her veins - recharging her body with artificial blood. An oxygen tube slips down her throat. An epidural into her spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts moans around her tracheal tube. Her eyes flutter op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the blood-spattered glass, she sees the parasite slither across Vickers's bed, tracking blood on the sheet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she slips into unconsciousness. Head lolling. Time pas 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manipulators reach into her wound. Re-positioning organs. Suturing ravaged flesh. A nozzle sprays antiseptic sealan Hours grind by in bloody labor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts's eyes snap open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vigoda breaks into the cabin, a gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scowls at the bloody track on the bed - and then freez seeing Watts inside the Med Pod, a vivisected woman. The autosurgeon hard at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite crawls into view behind Vigoda. It has alrea trebled in size. He does not see it before it leaps at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dies in seconds. His throat ripped open. Lies staring nothing. His submachine gun lies beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts's body jerks as manipulators tug and sew at her gut She stares at the dead man in a fog of horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parasite's skin splits, spraying the carpet with acid Limbs erupt from its shoulders and haunches. Spines from back. Metamorphosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a crack of carapace, its head swings down from its serpentine position. It becomes a devil with an lethal, elongated skull. An Alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien turns its head. Looks at Watts inside the Med P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her breath catches. She passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts wakes as the oxygen line withdraws from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down, bleary and hurting. Her star-shaped wound stitched closed with mechanically precise sutures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod releases the restraints securing her arms and leg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath. Looks out - and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights in the suite outside have been damaged somehow They flicker and strobe. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
