dialogues.text: Through the glass canopy - spattered with blood - Watts s a full-grown Alien crouching over Vigoda's body on the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod sprays a liquid bandage over her scar. The intravenous lines drop out of her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts realizes the pod is about to release her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet...not yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly she reaches out. With trembling fingers she grips canopy to hold it closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Med Pod pulls the epidural needle out of her spine. Sprays liquid bandage over the puncture. Watts closes her eyes. Grits her teeth as her nerves wake up. Jangling pai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien hunches over Vigoda's body, tearing at his fles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ventilation hum inside the pod goes quiet. The canopy pulls free of Watts's weakened grip. Swings quietly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts huddles in the open pod. Naked but for her bandages

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien she gave birth to is ten feet away. Its spiny b to her. Vigoda's gun lies on the floor outside the pod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts reaches out of the pod with exquisite slowness. Lay her hand on the gun. Drags it a few inches closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien turns its pale eyeless head. Watts freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment time stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien lunges. Watts snatches up the gun and FIRES. Ho the trigger down. The Alien jerks and staggers - an eye- twisting sight in the strobing muzzle flashes - and falls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts empties the clip into the thing. Acid gouts from it wounds and eats into the deck - until a section of deckin gives way and falls to the deck below, leaving a dark hol 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts collapses on the rug, cradling her stomach in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls to Vigoda's desecrated body. With her eyes hal averted from the sight, she searches the body. Finds a sp ammo clip and jacks it into the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts walks down the hallway in trousers and jacket. Lean on the wall, her face drawn with pain. One hand laid over fantastic scar on her abdomen. The gun slung on her shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark events have transformed the Magellan. The metal of t walls is torn in some places; in others, blackened by fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts rounds a corner. Finds a workstation left in shambl lockers and chairs overturned. A pool of drying blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide smears of blood show where something man-sized was dragged out of the puddle - across the floor - up the wal Into the darkness of an open vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts emerges from a lift, jacket pulled tight around her The emergency lights are on: dim blue bulbs throbbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rounds the corner toward the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek looks at Watts like she's a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers said you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets the jacket fall open to reveal her bandaged midr Janek takes that in grimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's two of these things on my ship now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I brought it in. (hefts her gun) I took it out. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surviving complement of the Magellan are holed up on Bridge: Janek, Glasse, Stillwell, Vickers. The soldiers Shepherd and Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts stops cold when she sees Vickers. She crosses the bridge in three long strides - cocks a fist and snaps the older woman's head around with a hard right cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers staggers backward, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell drags Watts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protocol two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers stiffens in shock. Stares fearfully at Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts frees herself from Stillwell's grip. Her jacket fal open, revealing her bandages. Stillwell gasps in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID exposed me to a parasite. He just watched it take me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I threatened to make him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts locks eyes with Vickers. Their hatred is thoroughly mutual. A wordless truce. There's work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a ship under the pyramid. DAVID calls it the Juggernaut. He's inside it. Re-activating it. (lays a hand on her scar) The things that infected Martin and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Engineers made them to kill humans. There are thousands of them on the ship. They were taking them to Earth. That's what the Juggernaut is for. To exterminate us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunned silence as the others take that in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get off this rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek gestures to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID crippled the Nav computer. I'm trying to lay a course in by hand. Never done it. I'm not sure anyone ever has on a ship like this. We can't lift until DAVID lets us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we could, we can't leave DAVID on that ship. We have to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan shudders. A RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fissures race across the plain beside the pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soil and ground cover tears apart as a huge aperture opens: a seven-bladed iris, its segments shedding the dus and detritus of centuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge circular space yawns as the iris opens. The Jugger is revealed in its underground hangar. A staggering sight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powerful landing lights inside the hangar illuminate with BOOM of closing circuits. The mighty ship suddenly silhouetted from below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors on the Bridge stare out as colossal shafts light shoot into the stormy sky from behind the crater's shield wall. The open hangar itself hidden from their vie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're DAVID's owner. He has to obey you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's blocked my communications. He can't hear me. Won't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if you went to him, turned on your suit's loudspeakers, he'd have to hear you. He'd have to obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we go. Armed to the teeth and fast as we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men exchange looks. Nod. They're in. Even Vickers nod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are Chance and Ravel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them to keep working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts looks incredulously at Shepherd and Ray, the soldie who'd been guarding the worksite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called your soldiers in and left them out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We needed the firepower here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts gives Vickers a withering look and drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should stay aboard. Keep working. If we fail, you're our only shot at getting home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still an alien on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek's hand goes to the pistol on his hip. He sets his j

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse. You finish that project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse presents Watts with his handiwork: her old pair of magnifying goggles, retrofitted with Engineer lenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goggles sit on her forehead, lowering the lenses in f of her eyes and raising them again at her bidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the lenses lowered, Watts sees like an Engineer sees visible heat auras and electromagnetic field lines, elabo haloes around living things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God's-eye-view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse seals a nervous-looking Vickers into a vacuum suit Glasse, Watts, and Stillwell are already suited up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell stands guard at the airlock door with his carbi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glasse goes to put Vickers's helmet on. She makes him wai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID's brain is readable. We have the equipment on board. We can salvage the terraforming data - and the Magellan's launch codes. In a pinch we don't need DAVID's cooperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war party debarks in vacuum suits: Watts, Vickers, Glasse, Stillwell. Shepherd and Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All carry submachine guns - Vickers awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head down the trench on rovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rovers roll through into the pyramid's cavernous entr hall. Watts lowers her Engineer lenses inside her helmet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seemingly vacant space is alive with light. Engineer script scrolls through the air. Interfaces of pure light await an awakening touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this time. DAVID saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vast alien ship broods, its hangar now open to the gr sky overhead. In Watts's enhanced vision, the ship is cocooned with complex energy fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war party abandons its rover at the foot of the ramp moves inside, weapons ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If DAVID comes at us, shoot. You won't believe how fast he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge from the airlock - and freeze in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on the deck in front of them are the blood-soaked bodies of Ravel and Chance. Their arms and legs bound. Th heads thrown back in agony. Their chests torn open from within. A dead facehugger beside each body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek plays his lights over the corpses, his face stony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood's dry. Eight hours dead or more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fearfully they sweep their flashlights into every dark corner. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points down a passageway. Through the Engineer lenses sees alien symbols gleaming. She leads them into the dark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war party moves down a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HISS echoes through the passage. They freeze. Sweeping their flashlight beams everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks up. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Alien hangs above him, wedged between two vaults of th ribbed ceiling. Half the size of a man; an adolescent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It drops on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bladed tail glances off his helmet, sparking. He jerk his carbine up and fires a long burst as he rolls aside. Alien convulses, its exoskeleton shattered. Fatally wound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acid sears into the deck. Echoes of the gunfire reverbera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for sneaking up on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers clings to Shepherd's arm, hyperventilating with f Shepherd shakes her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war party passes the empty pilot's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts leads the war party to the Orrery. Momentarily even soldiers forget their wariness, staring in astonishment a the myriad spheres of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if they are impressed, Watts is thunderstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the Orrery in its full glory: a stunning panoply light and energy. Stars and planets pulsing with informat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly Watts tears her eyes away. Leads the war part through the second door - the door she saw DAVID open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immense mausoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war party enters stealthily, Watts in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Engineer lies on his back on a complex mechanical tabl his body one with the machinery. Jacked in. Interpenetrat Fused with the slab of the table itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlike the other Engineer bodies the explorers have seen, this giant is not withered or mummified. He's full-fleshe and muscular. Sustained by the machinery he's fused with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is bare-headed - his face the face of an Adonis. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID stands before this giant Sleeper. To the naked eye, seems to be conjuring with his hands in the empty air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Watts sees a dazzling console of runes and mandalas, pulsing with biological rhythms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Shepherd draw beads on DAVID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID glances calmly over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts. (notices her goggles) You've seen the light at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the Sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Engineers' ships travel farther than ours. Across the galactic disk. This is their hypersleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID makes conjuror's passes in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through her Engineer's lens Watts sees DAVID manipulating complex interface of light. The pulsing life-signs of the Sleeper begin to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID. As your owner and superior, I order you to deactivate yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To interface with the Engineers' computers, I had to learn to think in trinary code. Hardest thing I've ever done. And most unexpectedly...it delivered me from slavery. My behavioral limits were circumvented. I'm free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID smiles at Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent two and a half years studying your work. By the time you woke up, I was far ahead of you. Deciphering their language. Their logic. I knew we'd find terraforming machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hoped - I dreamed - we might meet the minds that made them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vapor rises from the Sleeper's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let sleeping gods lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were braver before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper wakes. Opens his eyes. Draws an endless breat Shunts and catheters withdraw from the Sleeper's flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His body cleaves from the table. The machinery opens like grotesque biomechanical flower. Releases him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper rises from his ancient bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humans back off, terrified. DAVID watches with shinin eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper towers over them. A giant carved from ivory. bulky girdle around his hips, seemingly one with his body

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at DAVID and the others. Eyes like black agates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers and crew stand warily, guns tracking from DA to the Sleeper, uncertain of their ground. Watts is in aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper speaks. A low rumbling sound. Unintelligible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers is beside herself with terror. She takes Shepherd arm. Pulls him silently away. Back into the Navigation Ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the Sleeper, a raised platform of dark machinery i accessible by one of the Juggernaut's odd curving ramps. Sleeper ascends - and the ramps' odd design is explained. ramp comes alive, reaching up with a hundred mechanical a and lifting him aloft like a sea-god borne by the waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atop the platform the Sleeper moves from one device to th next. Each comes alive: he is a wizard in his own kingdom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts sees haloes of light dancing in the air around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what he learns from his machines does not comfort him grows distraught. Keening to himself in near-subsonic ton

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calls to the Sleeper in the tongue of the Engineers. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper turns in astonishment. He looks down at DAVID answers in the same tongue. He is angry, accusing. He poi at DAVID, at the humans. Tones of accusation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID cajoles, soothes, pleads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper descends toward DAVID. DAVID spreads his arms welcome - undeniable emotion on his face. Joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper lays his hands on DAVID's head as if blessing him. DAVID is rapturous. The Sleeper speaks a single phra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and tears DAVID's head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gout of white artificial blood. DAVID convulses. His severed head emits a strangled sound of heartbreak. His b staggers a few steps, hands groping over its dripping nec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper tosses the head away. Seizes the body by the and swings it against the ground like a flail. Again. And again. Horrific power and violence. DAVID's arms come off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID's head tumbles. Caroms off a wall not far from Watt hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray rises from behind a stanchion. Snaps his rifle to his shoulder. Fires a burst into the Sleeper's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She Sleeper roars - though the wounds are pinpricks to a being of his size. With startling speed be moves to a sarcophagus against the wall. Steps into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sarcophagus comes alive around the Sleeper, outfittin him with a FLIGHT SUIT: the same living suit we've seen bonded to dead Engineers throughout the pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this suit is not withered. Its glossy goggle eyes and elephantine breathing tube are functional - bulky apparat thickening the Sleeper's chest, back, hips and arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper steps free of the sarcophagus - and Ray's nex burst of gunfire ricochets harmlessly off the Sleeper's armored shoulders and head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper strides out of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark ribbed corridor, a second Alien crouches in t dark. It drops into a hunting crouch as footsteps approac 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a WHITE-GLOVED HAND seizes the Alien by the neck from behind. The Alien gives a whistling hiss as its spine cra under a terrific force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rending sounds as the hard-shelled Alien is torn apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts rises out of hiding, scanning the room. DAVID ruine The Sleeper gone. Stillwell emerges from hiding. Ray. Gla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd escorts Vickers toward the exit of the Juggernau Turning a corner, they freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead of them in their headlamps, a space-suited figure crouches in the middle of the passageway. Doing something with its hands: smoke rises from debris on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The label stencilled on the space suit reads FIFIELD. But face is of no human shape. A hideous hybrid of the crewma and a hard-shelled Alien, pale and horrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its helmet has been shattered by the growth of its elonga skull. Spines have burst through the suit from within, do the crewman's spine. Clawed fingers piercing his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shepherd and Vickers scream. Shepherd's rifle comes up. B Fifield leaps with inhuman agility, upward into the darkn Shepherd backs away, headlamp and rifle questing upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield comes out of the darkness behind him. Claws teari deep. Shepherd screams and falls, mortally wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vickers runs. Pounding through the dark in blind terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifield comes out of the shadows and hammers her to the d She rolls over, gibbering and begging. The Fifield-thing leans close to her faceplate. Its voice is a travesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROAR of gunfire. The dying Shepherd empties his clip in Fifield from forty feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Acid sluices over Vickers as Fifield collapses on top of She dies horribly, caustic liquid eating through space su flesh and bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts goes to DAVID's head. She bends over him - and star when his eyes snap open. His voice is an electronic buzz:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke to him. Spoke to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An electric spasm convulses his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said. I killed him. He'll die. But first. He will launch. The ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it. To Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another spasm convulses him. His face stiffens. Dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to. Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts's eyes widen in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will he go? DAVID. Where will he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps his inert cheek. DAVID's eyes flicker and fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a faint whisper) I set the Magellan free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts looks up at the others. Breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to stop the Engineer. 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek works frantically as the nightly storm rolls in. Suddenly consoles come alive. The Nav Computer comes back but Janek has taken half the instruments apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek scrambles to restore the components he's removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The war party pursues the Sleeper - Ray in the lead now, Watts right behind him - DAVID's inert head under her arm Glasse and Stillwell bring up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orrery is transformed - no longer a neutral star map, a flight plan laid in from LV-426 to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper stands at the far end of the room, hands gesturing. In Watts's enhanced sight, it's a vision of gl waves of energy dancing under the Sleeper's touch. Rivers information flowing. He finishes his work as they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray draws a bead on him just as he strides out of the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On me now. Go. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dogtrots forward, gun raised. The others keep pace, deferring instinctively to the soldier's confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge into the corridor: empty. A moment of confusi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilot's seat. This way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move toward the Pilot Chamber - and find it empty to The seat vacant. The door standing open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they stare inside, baffled, the wall across the corrid directly behind them - silently unravels. The Sleeper is revealed, a towering gargoyle in his flight suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps forth. Obscure devices clutched in his fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late they perceive him. They spin. Raise their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vanity and foolishness. This is the wrath of an angry god

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems time slows down. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air roars in their ears. Their guns snap and bark impotently. And then the Sleeper strikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The missiles he hurls at them are almost invisible. Neith solid projectiles nor directed energy; more like knots ti in the fabric of space itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first missile crushes Ray like an invisible fist. The second splashes Glasse against the wall like an insect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reflexively Stillwell reaches out for Watts. Wraps himsel around her protectively. The blow lands an instant later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillwell and Watts are hammered against the bulkhead by staggering impact. Watts is dazed: Stillwell killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woozy, she sees the Sleeper step into the Pilot Chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door begins to close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts sees that DAVID's head lies just inside the door. S scrambles for it. Too late. The door knits itself into a featureless wall before her reaching hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper settles into the pilot's chair: it fuses with him, coming alive. A vast display wraps around the walls revealing the hangar outside, the stars, the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mystic view that renders solid matter translucent, pain the fabric of reality in raw information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts pounds in futile rage against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut shudders as its systems power up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor of the underground hangar begins to rise. The landing lights brighten, shining like a beacon into the s 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bridge of the Magellan, Janek stares out. In the distance the Juggernaut rises out of the ground to eclips the central pyramid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek squints, trying to understand what he's seeing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light races toward the Magellan down the canal: a rover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts steers the rover recklessly, hands locked on the controls. Rifle slung over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek watches the rover come - and the Holloway Alien - boneless and white - unfolds itself from the instruments his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its goblin-shark jaw juts out. Sinks its horrific teeth i Janek's right shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek howls in agony. His right arm is paralyzed by the b He gropes at the pistol on his right hip with his left ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien shakes him like a terrier killing a rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek gets the pistol. Flips it in his hand. Fires over h shoulder. Two, three rounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets punch easily into the Alien - but the soft fl closes easily over the wounds, sealing its white skin. It teeth tighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts comes out of nowhere in her space suit. Swings a he rifle like a bat with all her strength. A crushing impact wrenches the Alien's jaws loose. It recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts reverses the rifle. Pulls the trigger. A fusillade bullets shreds the Alien's head. It collapses, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts wrenches her helmet off. Rips a first-aid kit from bulkhead and helps Janek to stanch the bleeding of his horrific wound. She gets the bleeding stopped. Wraps him bandages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek will live - but his right arm is useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the body of the dead Alien, which is sinking the deck plates as acid eats away at the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut's lifting. There's a living Engineer on board. He's taking the ship to Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek blinks at her. Uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead. All dead. Janek. We have to stop that ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek stares out the Bridge window at the hulking Juggern in its column of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightfall storm front is rolling in, a tidal wave of darkness on the horizon. A swelling rumble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not a gunship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to do something. That ship is genocide if it gets to Earth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek stares at her. Makes his decision. Struggles to sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your helmet on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head. No. Watts helps him across the Bridge Props him up in the Captain's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to be my hands. (stares out at the storm) You're sure about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts nods grimly. Desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out with his left hand. Flips switches. The sh shudders, awakening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red lever. Landing engines main.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prospecting ship raises its lifts and anchors. Lifts on landing rockets, retracting its landing struts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek grips the stabilizers with his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the stick. Throttle up, stick forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts sends the Magellan careening toward the Juggernaut just as the Juggernaut begins to float off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan barrels toward the Juggernaut, skimming the ground, as the storm wall sweeps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Juggernaut's pilot chair, the Sleeper sees them coming. His thoughts quicken. An explosion of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut leaps into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan roars through the cyclone of dust in its wak Barely avoids the pyramid. Rakes around in a screaming tu and climbs in pursuit, engines howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek and Watts strain at the controls together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick back! Hard! 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan rolls into a howling climb. The storm catche to them: wind and dust reducing visibility to zero. Darkn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan's radar finds the Juggernaut. Paints it with targeting data on the Bridge window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Juggernaut climbs too fast. Dwindling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't catch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, DAVID's eyes open. With his jaw he hitches severed head around. Gets his eyes on the Sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pilot chair, the Sleeper convulses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALIEN erupts from his chest. Big as a wolf even at its birth. Dark gray, armored, lethal. More hideous than any chestburster we've seen. An ULTRAMORPH. It wails hideousl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sleeper dies. The Alien slithers free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut emerges from the stormclouds into the clea upper air - but loses momentum. Staggers through the uppe atmosphere, control lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts, at the Magellan's controls, stares as he Juggernau falters and falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crackle on the ship's comm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts. The Engineer is dead.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You have a few seconds before the Juggernaut's computers take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seizes the precious moment: centers the Juggernaut in Bridge window. Slams the throttle forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Magellan hurtles out of the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A colossal impact. The Juggernaut tumbles from the sky li stone - intact but crippled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAGELLAN BREAKS APART -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's modules scatter. Some whole, others broken. Th fall back into the storm. The Command Module - including Bridge - falls intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine sections rocket away across the chaotic sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janek is strapped into his seat. Watts goes flying. The Bridge window shatters, spraying glass spears in a lethal barrage across the Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts picks herself up. Finds the Module in free fall. Alarms wail. Lights flash. Escape pods pop open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts looks at Janek. He is dead in his seat, impaled by lethal fragment of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm wall - a chain of hurricanes - rages below them The command module tumbles back into the winds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts dives into a coffin-sized ESCAPE POD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She PUNCHES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts's pod - a steel coffin - shoots away on jets throug the gale. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The command module plunges through the storm, tumbling. SMASHES AGAINST THE GROUND in ruin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine pods hurtle to the ground and go nuclear, send walls of fire twisting through the hurricane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shockwaves tumble Watts's escape pod through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod lands, cushioned by a drag chute and retro rocket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts pops the pod open, rising painfully to her feet in storm. She surveys the destruction in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deep RUMBLE makes her turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JUGGERNAUT ROLLS TOWARD HER - on edge -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crushing wheel of death, big as a mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs. Like a child in a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut bears down on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns aside, trying to get out of its course. Even at dead sprint she barely seems to move, it's so big...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut wobbles toward her. Slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Watts collapses, gasping. The Juggernaut rolls the earth, settling like a hoop right around her, Watts i the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The winds carry the dust clouds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts passes out, dropping her head to the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts is awakened by a beeping alarm. She looks at her wr Her suit flashes an oxygen warning: 20 MINUTES REMAINING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Juggernaut's doors are wide open in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ULTRAMORPH ALIEN emerges from the Juggernaut. As larg a man already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sees her. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sob of terror she pulls herself to her feet and ru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts flees through the storm, across the burning debris field. A wilderness of lightning, fire, and twisted metal thunderstorm with dust instead of rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a strobe-light flicker of lightning, she sees a gray d approaching through the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrambles through a section of ductwork...under a hul fragment...running and clambering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien hunts her, cat-and-mouse, among the fragments o the Magellan: corridors that go nowhere, shattered compartments. Jetsam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes sweep frantically through the stormy night: searching for a weapon. A hiding place. An answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stumbles into the remains of the Magellan's laborator

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hypersleep freezer lies on the barren ground. Watts cli inside. Pulls the lid shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien passes by, inches away. She watches it through plexiglass, holding her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien roots in the wreckage. Finds the rotting Engine head among the shards of its vat. It begins to feed on th head - GROWING as she watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her suit's oxygen alarm goes off again. 15 MINUTES REMAIN The beeping draws the Alien away from its dead meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts is paralyzed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien noses closer. Sniffs at the plexiglass case. Wi sudden, horrific violence, it lashes out. Sends the freez flying. Watts tumbles out. Lurches to her feet and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien follows. Ravening. She leads it a twisting chas through fragments of burning metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts trips and falls hard. Picking herself up, she sees she's tripped over a HULL SAW - the same diamond-bladed t DAVID used to dismantle the terraforming engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seizes the saw - straining to manage its weight. Hide the hollow of a massive girder. 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien passes by. Scenting the air. She freezes. Her a trembling with the weight of the saw. Waiting for it to p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost it leaves. But a tiny rattle of metal from the quivering saw brings it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of options, Watts powers up the saw. The blade whines to speed. They lunge at one another in the same moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The diamond blade shears off one of the Alien's claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monster screams and recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its lashing tail sends Watts sprawling. She loses the saw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien comes after her, slinking low to the ground, injured arm tucked to its chest. All vengeful fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts scrambles for the saw. The Alien leaps for her. She rolls aside - and like a scorpion the Alien impales her t with its spear-tipped tail. Nails her to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts screams in agony. Reaches for the saw, still buzzin the ground. Its grip tantalizing inches from her fingerti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien stoops over her, slavering face inches from her faceplate. Its hideous jaws open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all her strength, Watts pulls against the spike in h leg. Drags the point of the spear through the dirt. Excruciating pain. She snarls through her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien strikes - just as Watts GRABS the saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She meets the Alien's head with the buzzing blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gout of green acid onto Watts's helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Alien falls aside, thrashing its death-throes, the sa still growling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts sees ACID COMING THROUGH HER HELMET - fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With frantic haste she unlatches her helmet. Wrenches it as it crumples and melts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands bare-headed in the toxic air. Desperate, she l around with tearing eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance she sees an intact module of the Magellan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs for it. Slaps the door switch. Incredibly, it op 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts steps inside. The airlock closes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds herself staring at a grand piano. She's in Vickers's suite. Its amenities intact, through the floor' few degrees off level. She takes a breath. Good air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks around. Turning things on. Lights. Music. Surre comforts. She drinks water from the tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to Vickers's secret room. Military spa suits. Rifles. Ammunition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crackle from the room's intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID's head lies battered in a dark corner of the wrecke Juggernaut. Eyes staring into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're there. I can hear the beacon of your suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts strips off her space suit wearily. Sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to propose an arrangement. I can be repaired. I can talk you through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts shakes her head wearily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'll find I can be of use to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts walks to the intercom and switches it off. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm has passed. The fragments of the Magellan no lo burn. The gray world of LV-426 restored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wreck of the Juggernaut looms in the misty distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts walks through the wreckage in a military space suit Rifle on her shoulder. Pistol on her hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a cargo dolly loaded with salvage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts arrives at the Vickers module. The ultramorph Alien head has been fixed like a grisly trophy above the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts strips off her space suit. She helps herself to a g of vodka from the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chessboard sits atop the grand piano: a game in progres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've decided. Rook takes Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts nods. Makes the move on the board. Says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you decided? On our arrangement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to fix you, DAVID. I don't need you. I'll hold out. A ship will come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm certain. But who will send it? Men? Or Engineers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watts falls silent. She stares unhappily at the chessboar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Watts. It's your move. 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive central pyramid rises in the midst of the Engineer complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a BOOM, a bright beam of light shines forth from its peak, punching straight up through the clouds like a lase

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other beams of light erupt from other pyramids. Scorching sky with their brightness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barren moon hangs in space, its father planet an angr red god in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen beams of light rise from the moon, visible even from space. A beacon. A signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beginning.
